Also because of the outdoor location and standing water, the restaurant is a breeding ground for mosquitoes that will attack you relentlessly 😭

It's a very famous restaurant in the area, known for the dish that gives the place its name. Because of its fame, it's almost always crowded, so it's common to find a small queue at the entrance.Luckily, the line moved quickly, and we didn't wait long to be seated. The service was good and attentive. We tried the famous Khao Soi: it was tasty, and the ingredients seemed high-quality, but honestly, it wasn't excellent. Given the restaurant's reputation, I was expecting a bit more. It's good, but not the best I've had. They accept card payments.
Very tasty food, but there were many dishes that ran out, all dishes are spicy.
Khao soi is ok, desert is nice👍

Had to try Khao Soi Nimman because our driver recommended it—and it’s super close to our hotel! If you come to Northern Thailand and don’t try Khao Soi, it’s like you didn’t really make it here. We went for chicken Khao Soi, braised beef Khao Soi, stir-fried pumpkin leaves with oyster sauce, crispy ruby dessert in coconut milk, and fresh coconut water. Absolute must-try!
i had the beef khao soi and it was the best beef so tender and soft as for the khao soi it was so good

Best satay chicken and dessert in town. We also ordered 2 koh soi and were really tasty. The place can get a bit crowded cuz apparently it is a highly recommended place. So be prepared to wait a bit if you come for dinner. But definitely worth visiting!

This isn't my first time here at Kao Soy Nimman but it is my first time dropping the review. I've tried Kao soy from so many places around Chiang Mai, but honestly, Kao Soy Nimman is the best one yet. I get why it’s so famous...and now I 100% agree with all the hype 👍 The broth is rich, creamy, not too thick or liquidly and it's full of flavor, the noodles are perfectly cooked, and that crispy topping adds the perfect crunch. Everything just comes together so well. **Don't underestimate their chilli** Even though it’s already super popular with both locals and tourists, it really deserves the extra fame. If you’re in Chiang Mai and want to taste the best Kao Soy OR Khao Soi, this is the spot. Totally recommend! 👍
The service is fast and the khao soi, delicious!

Almost every tourist comes here to eat. The prices are a bit higher than other Northern Thai places. The decor and vibe are really nice. The Khao Soi is pretty spicy, and the other dishes are quite strong in flavor too. Worth a try if you’re around, but if there’s a long line, you can skip it.

Nice experience with an even better taste. Some seem to disagree but I couldn't see why. Press the button on your table and the staff is there within seconds to help you with anything you'd need. The chicken sate came with one of the best sauce I have ever tasted. The pork egg rolls were yummy and the Kao Soy was spicy and delicious. The drinks are good too, definitely worth a try!

Tried the Khao Soi Chicken and the Chicken Satay Peanut Sauce Noodle both were amazing. The Khao Soi had rich standard coconut curry broth, crispy noodles on top, and super tender chicken. The balance of spice, creaminess, and a squeeze of lime was just perfect. The Satay Peanut Noodles were such a nice surprise!!!! creamy, nutty, slightly sweet, with grilled chicken that had that smoky flavor 9/10. A great fusion of comfort food and Thai street style. Nice cozy spot with warm Chiang Mai vibes. Perfect for anyone who loves flavorful northern Thai food. Highly recommend adding this place to your food list when you’re in town! Must eat for anyone wanting to taste authentic northern Thai cuisines. Their Khao soy is rich and creamy, perfectly balanced between coconut milk and spices. Definitely a go to spots for Khao soy lovers in Chiang Mai.

Delicious bowl of Kao Soy. Just the right amount of chilli kick. The chicken leg was tender with the meat falling right off. We ordered the chicken satay as well it was grilled to perfection. We sat inside, which is air conditioned. Clean with hygiene. 100% recommend.

Amazing kao soy, really good food. Nice atmosphere and staff. I would recommend it 🫶🏻
Nice curry! The spring roll is great!
kao soy was served really quickly and the pork skewers is a must!!! personally it was more tastier than the noodles
Great atmosphere. Portion is big, price is gd, and more importantly taste is great!
Portions are a little on the small size but the flavour was excellent

This restaurant deserves to get its first Michelin star! All the products were not only very tasty, but the products also contained a unique blend of Norhern Thai-style flavors (which are in my opinion the better dishes of Thailand). We felt really treated like kings. The service was impeccable and no waiting thanks to the digital bell on our dining table. As a starter, we ate the soft, creamy and scrumptious eggplant salad, which I can really recommend to vegetarians. Also the chicken skewers with satay sauce was a great addition to our order, with a wink to the original chicken-satay skewers from Indonesia. Even the pickled veggies let me think of the Indonesian dishes for a while. However, I have to confess that I personally prefer an Indonesian-style satay sauce. For our main course we had a great stir-fried chicken dish with a great combination of spices. To add more spice to our dinner, we had the delicious Kang Nor curry dish. I really like this curry for the added bamboo sprouts and dried fish. As a non-pork eater, I obviously chose this fish-variety. However, they also have a pork-variety. My boyfriend and I were seated inside. The restaurant was well climatized and very clean. You could even look through the glass, where you could see the diligent people working hard to make exquisite dishes. Even the dining tables were of another kind of level. At the end of our dinner we realized that we had been sitting on a ‘remade’ authentic sewing table. It gives the restaurant so much more atmosphere. As a dessert, I ate colored soft noodles in sweet coconut milk. I must say that this type of dessert, has it all to me. We went to our hotel totally satisfied, joyful and fully fed. I can assure everyone that you will enjoy your meal here to the highest level!

The best Kao Soy I’ve ever had. The spiciness of the soup was perfectly balanced—neither overpowering nor too mild. Its consistency struck the right note as well, being neither too thick nor too watery. The two types of noodles, one firm and the other soft, added depth and variety to each bite. Midway through, the topping of lemon slices, onions, and pickled vegetables refreshed the flavor, making the bowl enjoyable from start to finish. Although about ten people were waiting outside, our turn came in just around 20 minutes.

Best local restaurant in Chiang Mai! A must go when you’re here! Amazing Khao Soi with tons of variations. The crab roe dish was delicious too! Very unique! Highly recommended for anyone looking for delicious authentic food and a great ambiance. Max wait time is 10-15 min, not too bad.

Housed in trendy Nimman, this is one of Chiang Mai’s Michelin-picked noodle playground that gives a modern spin to the Northern Thai classic: khao soi—a dish rooted in Lanna history, once brought over by Chinese-Muslim traders, now a Chiang Mai must-eat. Kicked things off with the Octopus Khao Soi—because why be normal when you can have tentacles in your soup? The octopus was chewy, not salty and a little bougie in the best way laying on top of a coconut curry hot tub. Then came the classic hero: the Chicken Khao Soi. A+ comfort food. That broth? Creamy, warm, just the right punch of spice. At some parts, the slurping was wishing the broth had just one more ladle of richness. Ended with a tropical pool party where the Thub Thim Krob came in like a treasure chest disguised as a dessert bowl.Signature ruby water chestnuts (crunchy, chewy, glorious) Grass jelly, cendol, and nata de coco and golden jackfruit pieces all vibing in one icy, sweet coconut milk party. Was definitely pleasing to the eyes but flavour wise went a little under. Still—worth the visit, especially if you’re khao soi-curious or full-on obsessed with the michelin adventure! Zoom off with a grab-bike ride that gives u more than local vibes 😉

Michelin-rated restaurant. Visited on 28 Feb 2025 at 6pm. High turnover, so don’t have to wait too long. We saw many tourists and some locals having their meal here. The Kao Soy Kai is a mixture of crispy noodle and normal yellow noodle. Blended well curiously. The ingredients were fresh, and the meat dishes were cooked well. We also ordered a drink each, and some dessert to share. Disappointed that the mango sticky rice was sold out. Price wise, it is reasonable: total of about 2,800 baht or 350 baht per person.

This bustling Northern Thai eatery delivers a lively, tourist-friendly intro to Kao Soi. The Super Bowl featured an assortment of grilled pork, chicken leg, and squid which offers a creamy, slightly sweet coconut-curry broth with firm egg noodles is approachable for newcomers, though purists might miss traditional depth. Portions are generous, and seating was immediate during our 2pm visit. Don’t skip the aromatic chicken satay skewers - tender white meat with a zesty chili-shallot dip. Highlights include the crab shell roe (tiny but intensely savory) and the peeled coconut—a refreshing, Instagrammable orb in a chilled metal cup. The vibe is energetic, with English menus and swift service, though prices lean higher than local joints. The ambience was pretty with all the overhanging ferns and plants however seated outdoors, there were a little too many flies around for comfort. Small eaters can share the Super Bowl (it’s huge!), skip the crab roe unless craving novelty, and visit mid-afternoon to avoid crowds. Ideal for first-timers seeking a hassle-free Kao Soi experience, but seasoned diners might prefer hole-in-the-wall authenticity. Still, a solid choice for flavorful, filling meals in a vibrant setting.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ (4/5 stars rating) I recently had dinner at “Kao Soy Nimman” with my partner, and it was a mixed experience. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was inviting and cozy, with a delightful blend of traditional Thai decor and efficient but unattractive (to the point) service —we got no help with recommendations and had to call service several times. 🌿✨ Let's start with the beverages. Despite their small selection, the fresh coconut water was refreshing, and the tea was perfect for the appetizers. 🍹🍵 The regular beers were also cold and refreshing. As for the food, it was truly spectacular! Each dish was a testament to Thai culinary craftsmanship. The “Mo Wah Pork Jerky” was expertly done, with a perfect caramelization that added a delightful sweetness and crunch to every bite. 🍖💎 The highlight of our meal was undoubtedly the “Kai Soy Stewed Beef.” The creamy sauce was nothing short of delicious, and the beef was tender and flavorful, melting in our mouths with each bite. It was a dish that left us craving more. 🍲🐄 We also ordered the “Pork Beef Grilled,” which, although flavorful, had a bit more fat than we preferred. However, the rich taste of the meat more than compensated for this slight inconvenience. 🥩🔥 Overall, "Kao Soy Nimman" delivered a mixed dining experience, with nice Thai food but regular service and restaurant atmosphere. We would recommend it when looking for something quick and delicious, no fancy or exotic ! 🌟🇹🇭 Pros: - Delicious and well-prepared dishes 🍽️ - Quick service - Inviting and cozy atmosphere 🌿 - Authentic Thai flavors 🇹🇭 Cons: - Short selection of beverage 🍹 - Brief and to the point service, unattractive or unwelcoming (we had to ask constantly, empty plates were there until asked to be removed)

My boyfriend had a different dish where he had a whole chicken foot just laying in the meal. (See in the picture) Chicken was also more bone than meat and the vegetables were so chewy that you couldn’t really eat them. When we paid our bill and the waiter saw that we gave back two full plates of food he didn’t even ask if anything was wrong with it. To top it all off I had a belly ache the whole night which I’ve never had before here in Thailand after eating. Two stars and not one because the Passion fruit juice and chicken Sate were good.

We had the Khao Soy Kai Jaew and it was simply delicious! We don't understand the negative reviews about the price, as we thought it was fair for the excellent quality and quantity of the food. An incredible gastronomic experience in Chiang Mai that we highly recommend!
Long queue, a large menu but honestly the Khao Soi and food generally is very average and nothing special. Seating is crowded. Will skip it next time.

Not worth the hype or the very long wait (can be 30 mins plus wait time. Someone actually left while we were waiting and said he had been waiting for too long). The food is good and we enjoyed it especially the grilled beef (though you can get way cheaper and just as tasty at the street food carts) but the Kao Soy was underwhelming. I had the Kao Soy Super Bowl and the prawns (aka shrimp) in it had a papery texture like when you freeze and defrost seafood. Didn’t taste fresh. The chicken drumstick in there was moist but was surprisingly bland and lacked the flavour I have come to expect from northern Thai food. The broth was nice and spicy and overall it was a tasty meal but just not worth the very long wait and the prices (we got 4 dishes and 3 drinks). The best Kao Soy we had was one we made ourselves at Mama Noi Thai Cookery School so definitely try that out if you’re a foodie. You’ll get delicious food and learn how to make it on your own whilst having a fun experience. If you really want to try the food here then maybe order it to go so you can pick it up later without having to sit around waiting or see if you can order it to be delivered to your accommodation via Grab.

Khao soy lived up to its reputation. Taste is perfect. We had fried pork but our daughter’s stewed pork was better. Quantity matches price. We were glad we ordered chicken satay (dipping sauce delicious) and fried egg rolls. They were out of mango and sticky rice. We had to wait about twenty minutes at 7:00 on Saturday night. Line looked long but went very quickly. Service very efficient.

This is a popular place to eat, we arrive 30 minutes early for dinner with friends.. there was a long queue ahead of us, and because one member of our party had a plane to catch, we wanted to avoid being delayed, but as soon as we joined the queue we were shown to a table for 4.. this was because the people ahead of us needed a much larger table together. This was fine, there was no pressure to 'free' the table, we had drinks while we waited.. 1 x beer and 1 x Grass Jelly Juice (A strange drink as it came in a bowl filled with ice and jelly strips that resembles slugs and a dark liquid, but it was quite refreshing - needed both a straw and a spoon). Our friends arrived, and food was ordered.... 3 x Kao Soy Stewed Beef, 1x Kao Soy Poo-Nim ( which is a soft-shelled crab dish), Sai Oua (this is spicy sausage), Kai Satay (chicken on skewers with peanutbutter sauce). More drinks: another Beer, Soda Water and 2 x Passion Fruit Juices. The dishes were delicious.. really good fresh, tasty food. The prices seemed reasonable, we did eat a lot (a dish each and 2 shared dishes plus 1 or 2 drinks each) and the bill came to baht 1275.. that's about baht 320 each. The atmosphere was lively, there was a lot of staff around to help, and they were so polite and efficient. We will be returning to try other dishes on the menu.
All food is spicy. Kao soy is good but not the best. small serving and expensive. Dessert is colourful.

Michelin accredited for year 2020 and year 2021. Not afterwards anymore? Crowded with tourists. Decent colorful menu. Both air conditioned indoor seats and outdoor open air seats. Kai Soy tastes just fair and in small portions. Fresh coconut juice is in nice presentation but of unstable quality. Young and soft coconut meat for the first order but old and very hard meat for the second order. There is a service bell on the table. Funny sound of pressing it, lol. Tried a few time but no waiter responded to it. You still have to wave your hands for service. Beware of mosquitoes bites if you sit outside. Bathroom is quite terrible. Dirty sewage everywhere.

Kao Soy Nimman is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the authentic flavors of Northern Thailand. This charming restaurant delivers the perfect blend of tradition and taste, making it a standout spot for Thai food lovers. The Food Their signature dish, Kao Soy, is a masterpiece. The creamy, curry-like broth is rich with spices, perfectly balanced, and full of depth. The crispy noodles on top add a delightful crunch, while the tender meat melts in your mouth. Every spoonful is packed with the bold, authentic flavors that define Northern Thai cuisine. The Drinks Adding to the experience, drinks are served in traditional Thai-style bowls. This small but thoughtful detail enhances the cultural vibe of the meal, making it feel special and unique. Whether you opt for a Thai iced tea or a refreshing herbal drink, the presentation is sure to impress. Why Visit? • Authentic Taste: The Kao Soy here truly captures the essence of Northern Thai flavors. • Unique Presentation: Serving drinks in Thai traditional bowls adds a fun and cultural touch. • Great Atmosphere: The warm and inviting ambiance makes it a great place for a casual meal or introducing friends to Thai cuisine.
Got chicken leg Khao Soi and satay skewers. The food was really good and well presented.

Khao Soi is considered a comfort food to me since I’m from South East Asian Chinese, it does make me feel like curry mee! But this is different, it is northern thai cuisine, taste good! Nothing to complaint, if u have time just come to try
The service was efficient and the food waa fresh and hot. The kao soi was light and tasty and the portion was just nice.
We were advised to eat here by our grab driver in order to try Kao Soy (typical food from Northern Thailand). It was super good and the atmosphere is also very local with few tourists. We loved it!
I love this place! khao soy with various toppings, also the bamboo worms are nice
Great Khao soi, good location. There was a queue, but waiting was not too long.

Delicious khao soi at reasonable rates! One bowl costs somewhere around 100 baht & it's very filling with a sufficient quantity of protein! You can also opt for a vegetarian one if you'd like! The curry (broth) of the khao soi is flavorful and is definitely the USP of this restaurant. I also tried their chicken satay which tasted tender and slightly sweet. Great, overall! I visited on a weekday evening and did not see any queues/wait time. Service is quick with efficient & polite waiters!
Khao Soi portion was so small.
Best Kao Soy I've had! Perfect balance of sweet, spicy and salty, lots of umami in one bowl. We ate till the last bit!

Really nice restaurant from the food till the service, we are a couple of dishes including the famous Khao Soi, and it was delicious with Pork. We also ate another Spicy Chicken with bamboo shoots, not much to eat tho almost all the ingredients are spices or things for cooking. Anyhow I definitely recommend the place for people visiting the city for the first time and you want to sit in a vibrant area with a great atmosphere.

Honestly... overrated. Wannabe posh place but the food is mediocre and not worth the price. Would not recommend it for vegetarian or vegan as the broth is chicken based. This kinda defeats the purpose of offering mushroom and egg khao soi. We wanted to try the desserts but had to leave as the amount of mosquitos in the outside area was overwhelming. Not worth it.
Very tasty food with a good selection of Northern Thai dishes!

One of the greatest restaurants I’ve ever been to! The Khao Soi was amazing—I’ve never had anything like it. Everything we ordered was fantastic. We got the beef skewers, but now I know we should’ve gotten the chicken skewers like everyone else. Overall, it was an amazing experience. We got there at 3 p.m. and only had to wait 30 minutes. Make sure to get a ticket from the staff when you arrive!

This is a good bowl of Khao Soi. I got the beef and my girlfriend ordered the chicken curry. We were both satisfied with our meals. We did have to wait around 10 minutes to be sat on a Sunday. Fair price for the food.
We tried Khao Soi with seafood it was really delicious! PS: it's a famous restaurant, we had to queue to get a table but it was fast and the service was great!

This restaurant has an amazing Northern Thai menu, but is especially well known for its many choices regarding their speciality dish, Kao Soi. You can order it almost any way that you like, with or without meat. They offer Kao Soi with tofu, mushrooms, or just vegetables for all of us vegetarians. There are other vegetarian options on their menu, also. We really enjoyed the vegetable Thai omelette! Very delicious! It’s a busy place because it is so popular, so arrive early if you don’t like to wait. Service was very good because every table has a call button for the waiters, and they always respond almost immediately. Prices were very good, too. We will definitely return here and recommend this place to others.

Was here before 10am, hence no q when they started serve. Service and atmosphere is good. Ordered The curry noodles topping with fried crispy noodles & chicken leg / fried pork. Too much fried crispy noodles, not really able to soak the curry, don't feel really match the taste. The curry noodles somehow overated. Very oily and lack of aroma of curry. Maybe this is the taste of khao soi...XD

Beautiful atmosphere and outdoor seating. Food came quick, khao soi was nice and the chicken satay is a must try. It was incredibly juicy and tender. The calamari was also good but chewy compared to the calamari in the Khoi soi that was very tender. Thai tea was solid, sweet and strong but not overly sweet.
Delicious food and very fast service. Put this place on your "must visit" list if you're in the area!

I was disappointed with my experience. There was a queue, mostly tourists like myself. Restaurant is clean and tidy, presentable, with prices higher than elsewhere (75 baht instead of 55-60 baht) catered towards the tourist crowd. Portion size was good for sampling at best (2 mouthfuls and done). Khao soi here was not crazy good, unlike what the Michelin guide sticker on the doorfront would suggest. Would recommend Mae Sai instead if in the area for Khao Soi. You got to queue at either places anyway.

The best khao soi of our trip, thanks to the recommendation from the local massage aunty. Guess it lives up to its Michelin Guide recognition, with a queue forming even before the shop opens. The beef khao soi was especially delicious, with super tender meat. The chicken thigh version was good too, though I preferred the beef. The fried egg with pork was just okay. Coconut was fresh!
one of the best khao soi u could get in chaingmai. soups are slightly flavourful than the other places.

This place is really crowded and always active !! We tired our first Khao Soi here since it was Michelin guided. We had to take tokens for the seat , we thought it would take long time so we walked around turns out we missed our no. and had to take another token . While waiting for our turn many people whose token were before us weren’t there so our turn came really quick in 5 minutes or so . Khao Soi here is really flavorful and delicious!
Overpriced and tiny portions! 100-130thb for a 5-bite bowl…tasty but not worth it when other shops are 50thb a bowl
Nice curry and authentic food
i'd definitely give 5stars if the broth wasn't cold.

The only downside to this culinary gem is that Thai food at home will never be good enough again. Kao Soy (Khao Soi) is a Northern Thai specialty that is everything you love about noodle soups but with a little extra Thai zing. It was spicy and hearty and coconutty and the noodles were rich and perfectly prepared. If I ever return to Chiang Mai, this place will be dinner on night one.
Some of the best northern Thai food I've had! The Khao SOI was delicious but the garlic pepper pork and Thai northern sausages were heavenly! One of the best meals I've had in Thailand
Best Khao SOI in town.Period

Visited on saturday 2pm, some queue, waited less than 10 minutes to get table. Get your queue number when you arrive. We ordered chicken kao soi, pork kao soi, chicken satay and butterfly pea flower lime juice. Kao soi: nice flavour, curry. Egg noodles in curry topped with crispy noodles and salted preserved vegetables. Chicken satay: tender, but lacks flavour or charred taste im used to. One of the skewers is raw inside, notified staff. Staff was apologetic and offered not to charge the satay. Hopefully, i won't get food poisoning 🥲😭 Butterfly pea flower lime juice: refreshing
Best Khao Soi, satay, and coconut desserts I've ever had! There is quite a line and expect a wait of at least 30 minutes to maybe several hours on a busy weekend.
I didn’t like the texture of the noddles compared to other ones I had around, but the soup is not that spicy. Overall, I think I would order if I don’t know what to eat.

15/11 come in the afternoon for lunch but too many people waiting, and I come in 5pm, there’s no need to wait for the seat. Order 3 dishes , and find that taste is just average. Not worth for queuing long hour but if no need to queue, you can try once.

Be prepared to wait for long Q. Waiting time can be as long as 45mins to an hour at minimum; unless u come early before they open and take a Q number in advance. This place is famous for Khao Soi… so it’s a must order here. The taste is good and would rate it almost perfect 9.9/10. They also have a selection of other Thai food & desserts.
Really amazing food and the service is pretty fast. Have generally had a bit more oily Khao soi so glad this one was more balanced.

This wasn't the best Khao Soi I've had in Chiang Mai; the broth seemed a bit bland. The prices here are quite high compared to other places but if you want to try a place on the Michelin guide you pay the price. They charge you for a bowl of ice about 20 baht. Very famous among tourists and can be crowded during lunch. We had to wait in a queue for about 40 mins. Besides the signature Khao Soi, we ordered several side dishes. The crispy pork skewers tasted quite good but not crispy, we had the mango sticky rice, the portion is huge but taste was just average. However, the dining environment is nice. This place is quite famous, but I think it's overrated.
Excellent meal. The khao soi soup is fragrant and the egg noodles are bouncy. The chicken satay was surprisingly tender and flavorful—would recommend.

Kao Soy Nimman, highlighted in the Michelin Guide, is a notable spot to experience khao soi in Chiang Mai. Michelin recognition attests to its quality and consistent appeal among locals and tourists. Khao soi itself is significant in Chiang Mai and Northern Thailand, known for its coconut-based curry broth, rich spices, and soft-crunchy noodle texture. A unique fusion of Thai and Burmese culinary influences, khao soi is cherished as a warm, hearty dish and has become an iconic part of Chiang Mai’s food culture, symbolizing local heritage and flavor. While it’s tourist-friendly and conveniently located, some visitors feel it’s slightly pricier than local spots nearby. It’s a recommended stop for travelers looking to try authentic Thai flavors.

This place was packed when I arrived. There was a wait outside and you have to grab a number from the guy that works there. Even so I waited maybe 10 minutes tops and it was so worth it. Food and service were amazing. 👍👍

Great food and very quick service. There is usually a wait and they will give you a green ticket when you arrive to wait for your table. The wait was about 20 minutes on a Monday at 2pm. I expect it is longer at more popular times. The food was worth it though. The Koh Soy Beef was the best I’ve had in the city but a little small. The Fried squid was also very tasty and crunchy and pretty large! I loved the functionality to push a button and get a server quickly. Also, they DO accept credit cards unlike the donut and tea place right outside the restaurant.
Nice atmosphere, great service, average food.
I’ll have Kai soy dreams for the rest of my life

Service was great. It’s a very unique place to visit, the food was good, price is fair. Please note they charge you for a bowl of ice, it was on the menu but we didn’t pay attention and we got changed $20 THB for it.
My favourite restaurant in the world. Super fast service. Amazingly tasty Kao Soy. Great ambience. Can’t wait to return.
Good and efficient queue system. Not a fan but i can understand why their noodles are popular. Worth a try.
This place is nicely done up. Served nice Curry Noodle, the satay is a must to order as well. Simply love the buttery pea drink. So refreshing! Price is very reasonable as well!
Food was good, location beautiful, very busy

The must visit northern Thai food located in middle of Nimman road. It has been awarded the best restaurant with the Michelin guide. Recommend to visit early like 11 am or late afternoon to avoid queues. Try what they recommended and you won’t miss any dishes.
Good taste of noodle even the mango sticky rice☺️
Yum

I ordered Khao Soi beef , chicken skewers and the dessert The beef was a bit tough and not as tender as expected and the gravy is rather thick and Smokey . Definitely worth a try for anyone who is seeking for a different taste of khao soi in Chiang mai but it isn’t my personal favourite overall However the red chestnut dessert is rather mind blowing ! The chicken skewers is good , loving the nutty sauce and the juiciness and tenderness of the chicken .
I ordered curry beef noodles and chicken noodles. Take it away, or you will have to wait an hour to order
This place makes me want to go back to my reviews of other restaurants and remove a star. That's how good this place is.
Amazing Khao Soi, absolutely would recommend trying it here.
Delicious khao soi in a lovely setting. Well be back.

The place is really pretty and nice to sit, however the food wasn’t that good. I’ve had khao soi before and this wasn’t nearly as good, the food was a bit cold and we got some skewers that tasted good but the meat was very tough. I wouldn’t return, specially being in Thailand there are way better places.
Curry noodles taste good

Date of Visit: August 22nd This is a famous restaurant in Chiang Mai, selected alongside Khao Soi Mae Sai in the Michelin Bib Gourmand. I visited during lunchtime, but there were plenty of seats, so I could order without waiting. The portion size felt larger than at Khao Soi Mae Sai, the price is a bit higher. If you don't like the strong flavor of curry, this place might be more suitable.
Had high hopes but was disappointed. The main noodle had very little soup and the chicken drumstick was not hot at all. Chicken satay was alright.
Nice Asian style curry favour noodle. The curry is combination of coconut favour, curry powder and slightly sour taste. Drumstick is tender, noodle is just nice. I impressed with their satay also...

This is one of the Michelin restaurants, but I found it to be just okay. We ordered different types of Khao Soi (Curry Noodle) to try. The taste was good, but it wasn’t the kind of flavor that left us in awe. Walking distance from One Nimman, we visited for dinner around 7:30 PM on a Friday night, and the line was long—we waited about 20 minutes to get a table. Overall, it was a decent experience, but not extraordinary.
Delicious food. Highly recommended. The beef kao soi was amazing ❤️
Very tasty, lots of space

Very touristic. Food is admittedly good but priced for tourists. You’ll get better khao soy at more local spots at a much lower price. That said service is efficient and can’t be faulted. Ordered the khao soy seafood (decent but 145thb), crab butter (so so can skip) and jackfruit salad (surprise standout - excellent).
Their dishes are small in portions but very delicious. If you are going for mango sticky rice ask in advance to keep one for you :) Chicken satay were okay..
Unreal Kao Soy here! Super tasty and really good value for money! Came here 2 nights in a row and would highly recommend!
Great tastes and a good spot to try a variety of the northern foods. Has an AC spot towards the inside area.

We had a short Que, Took 10 min to get our order in but the place was busy. The food was good, I enjoyed my khao soi, the chicken satay was really good. Only negatives were they don’t accept credit cards and bathroom was dirty. Others I’d give 5 star. Prices little high but food was good quality.

We stumbled upon Kao Soy Nimman while taking a walk, drawn in by its charming decor. The restaurant offers plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors. Despite arriving at 4 PM, there were quite a few groups enjoying their meals. It was only later that we realized this place is Michelin-recommended—a pleasant surprise! We opted to sit outdoors, though indoor seating with air conditioning was available. Despite the hot weather, the standing fans kept the outdoor area comfortably cool. Initially, we planned to just have dessert, but the signature Khao Soi on the menu looked too appealing to resist, so we decided to share a bowl. We're glad we did! The noodles were cooked to perfection, and the Thai lime, onion, and salted vegetables added a unique twist that elevated the dish. For dessert, we ordered two options: the Passion and what I believe is called Chendo (though I’m not certain of the name). I preferred the Passion drink, which was refreshingly cool, though it wasn't as sour as I expected—it could have benefited from a stronger passion fruit flavor. The Chendo had a variety of ingredients, but it wasn't as fragrant or flavorful as similar desserts we’ve had back home. Overall, I really enjoyed our visit and would love to return to try more of their dishes. The ambiance, food, and service made for a delightful experience.

This is a restaurant mainly for tourists, and the price level is more expensive than other Thai restaurants that sell similar kind of foods. The quality of the dishes and other things such as atmosphere, service etc. are all good.

There are a lot of ads, Michelin stickers everywhere, but I don't understand why? In fact: Lab Nua is completely tasteless, as are the rest of the dishes we ordered. Khao Soi is normal, but only average. There are a lot of people, but the staff tries and copes with the service quite well.

Busy restaurant. Service is quick and attentive. I had the Kao Soy Hed (vegan/mushroom) the broth was flavourful, noodles well cooked. Get some sticky rice and dunk in the broth. Try the Passion fruit juice as well.
There was a short queue when we got there around 1pm on a weekend, but still worth the wait! Food is slightly pricier given that it’s Michelin! Will definitely visit again!
Khao Soi is amazing. The beef is tender and the curry sauce is savoury. However, the dessert is disappointing. The coconut milk used is expired with a weird taste. Just order Khao Soi.
Nice with a traditional taste. Nice lanna atmosphere. Despite the large staff, service is a little slow.
There was a line. There were 20 people in front of us. In general, everything is fine. The guys are good, they clean and take out the dishes when they are ready. Kao Soy was great!

Good taste, small portion ( two or three bites) , overcrowded and overpriced, Waiting for 30 min- 1h to be served Don’t park on the narrow street, as ur car will block the street and got fine and locked by the police. There is a parking lot nearby charged 50 baht, which is easy to find

The Khao soy with chicken and iced chrysanthemum were perfect. Loved the combi. Each guest will be given a queue number. Line was quite long when I reached at around 1+pm, but when I left the line seemed a lot more manageable!
Another michelin stop we tried this time, their famous Khao Soi. Tasted very good and staff were efficient and kind

Such a great restaurant and it’s worth the hype! The beef Koa Soi was delicious - the best Thai food I’ve had while here. I also had the pork wontons which were ok but wouldn’t order again and the chicken satay which was yummy. Overall would definitely come here again and it deserves the Michelin guide!
Our first ever Kao Soi and it was delicious! Found this place through an online review and so glad we went.
Nice place for dinner and hangout on bars, few bars around the area.
Really good khao soi! Must try if you want your beef tender and with little fat.
Best kao soy in town We loved sausage 😋
Quick meal delivery, plenty of flavour ! Just what we were looking for

Popular place among tourist since the banner at its shop front says it's featured in the Michellin Guide 2020. Price is on the highside by local standard. The Khao Soi was good, though I'm no expert to determine if it's authentic. The chicken satay was surprisingly good, tender and juicy, rather different from the satays you would find in Singapore or Malaysia. The platter of sausage and vegetable is nice, I particularly like the saugage. Dessert is decent too.

This wasn't the best Khao Soi I've had in Chiang Mai; the broth seemed a bit bland. The prices here are quite high compared to other places. Typically, you can get Khao Soi Kai for around 60-70 baht, but here it costs 90 baht. Besides the signature Khao Soi, we ordered several side dishes. The satay chicken skewers were quite good, but the rest were just average. Especially the desserts and ice cream, which we didn't finish. However, the dining environment is nice, one of the few air-conditioned restaurants in Chiang Mai. This place is quite famous, but I think it's overrated.

The Kao Soyli overall taste was great. The curry soup for Kao Soi was on the mild side. The stewed beef was very well made. The price is not cheap for Kao Soi, but hey you want to try a place on the Michelin guide right? Very famous among tourists and can be crowded during lunch.
The overall flavor is good! I love this khao Soi soup!

The food was so good, very tasty. The staff is friendly. They serve the food really fast. There’s a button on the table you need to press to call for service to place your order or to pay. We came on a Wednesday night without any reservation.

My favourite food in Chiangmai! We ordered 3 Khao Soi and the Mushroom Dip, my Thai friend previously brought me we tried their traditional dips too. Remember to dig in their northern Thai sausages when you are there because it’s a must eat to me too! Khao Soi taste like curry noodle with the flat egg noodle, served with whichever meat you pick and lots of “wanton” skin which is my fav 😋 it’s not too spicy for me (I’m a Singaporean that usually don’t eat spicy food) Loved their dessert as they are pretty generous with the fillings, it has a flower taste to it besides having the main coconut taste. A must have for a HOT day 🤭

Yummy Kao Soy and definitely one of the best. Highly recommended for Kao Soy lovers. There were many options, Kao Soy with sai ua, with seafood, chicken and many others. My favourite is the combination of my two favourites in Chiang Mai,Kao Soy and sai ua.. sai is the yummiest pork sausage I have ever tasted. This place also serves great chicken satay with sweet peanut gravy. Really yummy. Also cendol, similar to Malaysian but without red beans, and other condiments. Pretty tasty nevertheless. Highly recommended to sai ua and Kao Soy lovers. Awesome hospitality from the staff and great ambience. Love this spot
Ate indoors on a hot day. AC was good, khao soi was great! It’s a bit on the lighter side than other khao sois I’ve had in the past but it was a refreshing change. Beef was super tender!

If you can only sit outside, then it's not worthy. Gold noodles taste fantastic, better than other restaurant's. What I didn't like most was things could be blown by fans over the table, including your changes....
Standard of the Khao soi has drop a little from few years ago. The soup was a bit bland .

I went there bcs I was in the area and they got michelin so I thought "Why don't just try it?". No waiting line at around 2.30 PM. The service is quite nice and fast. I tried Kao Soy with chicken, the soup and fried noodle was so good but I think the chicken was so so. You can try if there's no line, but you can also find another Kao Soy in the whole city

Definitely not recommended. No matter what you want, good Khao Soi or Tom Yum or friendly service, go somewhere else (there are a whole lot of nice restaurants here!) We waited for a few minutes and ordered soft crab Khao Soi and Tom Yum soup. Both served in astonishingly small portions and below average quality. Only a few frozen shrimps and a pile of spice in the soup. 别来！别来！
Best kai soy and dessert we had in Chiang Mai , portion are generous and price is acceptable

I came to Khao Soy Nimman in March and it was close. So I am so happy today I can eat this delicious food. I never had seafood Khao Soi in Bangkok. It’s first time try seafood and chicken Khao Soi. 😋😋👍🏻👍🏻

This Michelin guide spot has incredible and there are typically large crowds— for good reason! Their Khao Soi is absolutely delicious, and we’re already planning to go back! Although it’s hot soup in hot weather, absolutely worth it. Also enjoyed their chicken satay with incredible sauces (so good I devoured half before remembering to take the picture!), and such flavorful Chiang Mai northern sausage too. Absolutely must visit in Chiang Mai for their khao soi!

Came with my friend but ordered curry mee and spring roll only. When they served the food, they gave us two sets of cutlery without request. The staffs really offered a good service. The food also not bad definitely deserve five stars from us.

Our favorite khao soi in Chiang Mai…and we’re not the only ones who love this spot, expect about a 30 min wait after grabbing a number from the staff. The restaurant is beautiful, open air, and cool roofing to give it a garden vibe. They obviously specialize in khao soi - we grabbed stewed beef and chicken to compare. Both were creamy and coconuty with a delightful kick of spice, a blend of crunchy and chewy yellow noodles and tender meat (the beef just melts in your mouth) Drinks were refreshing and the Thai sausage was unfortunaly a miss - a bit on the dry side and packed full of spices, I found myself having to wash it down with water constantly. Overall a great experience! :)
The Kao soi here is incredible! Quick service, delicious food, nice atmosphere. Much recommended
Best Kao Soy I’ve ever had! Food, service, and ambience are all 5 stars. This is a must try! We also got satay and tempura shrimp - all very tasty.

We visited this restaurant twice, and both the food and the environment were great! However, by local standards, the pricing was indeed a bit on the higher side. We ordered the Khao Soi Stewed Beef, where the beef absorbed the delicious curry sauce, making it very flavorful, and the noodles were more elastic and chewy compared to others we've had elsewhere. We also tried the Rod Duan (fried bamboo worms), which had no strange taste but were instead filled with a bran-like aroma. We originally wanted to order grilled chicken, but customers at the next table who had ordered grilled chicken/pork/beef recommended we try the grilled beef, which proved to have an excellent flavor. Additionally, we tried the Thai Boiled Wild Mushrooms (Nam Prik Kha Hed Tob), which had a crisp texture and could be dipped in the provided Galangal Chili sauce, though I found that sauce to be a bit too spicy for me. For drinks, we tried Pennywort juice, Gardenia flower juice, and shelled coconut. Each had its unique flavor, but the portion sizes were quite small given the price. We avoided peak hours to escape the crowd and potential wait times, so during our visits, there were more servers than customers. They were all very enthusiastic and patient in introducing us to the dishes, and they responded quickly whenever we had questions or needed to add an order. If your travel budget isn’t too tight, we highly recommend giving this place a try.
Kao Soy - Special Local Noodle in Chiangmai. Must try 👌🏻
Tried big bowl Kao Soy and seafood one. Good ambience and seating.
Beef and pork is too dry.
Excellent Beef Kao Soi! It could have been a little warmer, but the flavor was worth 5 stars.

Visited this spot twice over my stay in Chiang Mai. There was a 15 minute wait the first time I was there on a weekday around 11 am, but I was surprised to be so speedily seated when I dropped in for dinner on Sunday around 4.30 pm. Absolutely love the food. Value for money and flavourful. Give them a Michelin star for 2024!

Delicious food. The price is on average 150 Bath per meal. The restaurant was included in the Michelin Guide 2020. Khao soi had an excellent taste, the sharpness was just right. The prawns were perfectly fried, and not greasy at all. The sauce for the shrimp was unnecessarily thick. I'm lowering the rating for the service, I waited around 25-30 minutes for the second meal for no reason. When I asked about my order, they brought it within 5 minutes without an apology.

An excellent northern thai food restaurant especially thai curry noodle (Khao Soi) Curry soup was excellent. There were lots of topping to eat with Khao Soi. Other northern foods were good. Northern thai sausage was very good. Green chili sauce ( Nam Prik Noom) was very good.
Beef Khao Soi was great. Some of the other customers there might be a bit noisy. If you go during a regular meal time it seems likely that there will be a bit of a wait.

How long can a restaurant keep their Michelin certificate! ( base on the sign show 2020). Positive : *Really reasonable prices as a Michelin restaurant. *Easy to find . Adjust your dining times maybe you can skip the queue. Negative: *Staff not friendly. And I’ve teaching 3 table of customers used the white bell to call for service ( coz they keep shouting for order and no one care about ) photo 2 *We order Khao Soi “ Tom-yam “ fry vegetables and rice . Khao Soi serve in 5 mins , but after 15 mins we asking where ours other meals , than Veg. & Rice presents , but Tom-yam told 10 more mins . Photo 3 . ( so my partner watching me finish mines, then my turn for watch her dine) By the end, if your got many days stay on Chiang mai , can try . If not better go other place ( my recommend KRUA DABB LOB )

Kao Soy Nimman is a popular restaurant located in the trendy Nimman area of Chiang Mai. The restaurant specializes in Kao Soy, a traditional northern Thai dish that consists of a rich and flavorful curry broth served with tender chicken or beef and crispy noodles. The restaurant's cozy ambiance and friendly service make it a great spot for a casual meal with friends or family. In addition to Kao Soy, the menu also features a variety of other northern Thai dishes, as well as some international options. Overall, Kao Soy Nimman is a great place to enjoy some delicious northern Thai cuisine in a relaxed setting.
Awesome place for khao soy!

Checked out Kao Soy Nimman, a spot that's got a nod from Michelin, so you know it's got some serious creds. True to the hype, the place was packed, with a no-reservations policy meaning you grab a number and hang tight for your turn. Dropped by on a weekday, post-lunch rush around 2pm, and still clocked a 40-minute wait. Went straight for their namesake dish, the Kao Soy. Pretty tasty, though it leaned towards the saltier side - flavor lovers would be into it. The chicken BBQ was alright, nothing to write home about. Price-wise, it's a winner, and the vibe of the restaurant is pretty chill, albeit super busy. They could do with a few more hands on deck, as getting the bill took a bit of effort and a couple of reminders. Was the wait worth it? Depends on your mood and schedule. If you're looking to kill some time and escape the heat, it's not a bad option. But if you're not up for the wait, maybe swing by during off-peak hours.

I arrived at 7:30pm on a lunar new year day and queued for 30 mins to get a table, but the wait was totally worth it. The khao soy was a delight - it’s so flavorful with so much texture to it. Also ordered a pork belly and a curry rice noddle. All dishes are an explosion of flavors and at very reasonable prices. I was still dreaming about the khao soy when I woke up the next day.

i’m not sure why it’s so highly rated and packed with long lines? the khao soi is not amazing, just decent and more on the sweet side. my biggest gripe is the tiny portions of the noodles - esp for what you’re paying. no chilis to add. toppings were fine. a bit overrated i think.

Their Kao soi is a delicious curry soup with firm noodles and crispy noodles on top. The chicken I had was succulently flavoursome, and paired well with the crispy fried noodles on top. We waited around 40min when we came on a Wednesday lunchtime (12:30 ish). But towards 13:30 it’s not as busy
My first taste of khao soi and I liked the raw red onions the most. The flavour of the broth was ok but didn’t stand out for the price charged.

Really popular with tourists! We still waited in line for a while before closing. Small portion of noodle with affordable price. Great taste. Worth a try if you never had Kao Soy, but there are plenty of other choices too!
The food wasn't up to the same quality as it was when I went a few years ago.

I'm starting to wonder if a Michelin Star is the kiss of death for a restaurant. It seems like the longer a place has had a star, the worse the quality gets. The food wasn't bad, but I don't think it deserved a star. My wife came here last year and said the food went downhill compared to now. Even my favorite Kow Soi place has decreased in quality after getting a Michelin star. Again, it wasn't bad, but it should've been better. Oh and why tease me with a beautiful picture in the menu of Kow Soi duck if you don't actually serve duck?!?

We were craving for Kao Soy and we found this on Google Maps, never noticed this is a Michelin Restaurant until we reached there then only we knew. I think it's because of peak hour, the staff are all busy to approach us, so we kind of wait for some time for the table and also ordering. We ordered two different types of Kao Soy, the taste is okay but doesn't taste any spicy, we are not sure what the taste is supposed to be because this is our first time having Kao Soy 😄 Not to mention, the dessert can taste the ice from the icebox 😂 Again, we are not sure if that is 'normal' tastes? Overall it is okay, will try the other Kao Soy restaurant in future.

I got the pork option, 90 baht. I was surprised to find out water is 20 baht. Personally the broth was too greasy and sweet for my taste. However the pork was cooked very nicely. I also liked the shelled coconut that my friend ordered. It’s definitely pricey compared to local khao soi which is around 50 baht. I would go to a smaller restaurant so you don’t have to wait.
Nice place. Sorry I forgot to take a picture of food. Just steamed rice and chicken wings. Simple but tasty.
Must try west Thai cuisine, chicken curry noodle.

Really delicious Khao Soi. I ordered the Thai sausage Khao Soi for a change and it was really delicious! Great depth of flavour and the perfect level of spice. 99 baht for chicken Khao Soi and 125 Baht for the Thai sausage Khao Soi. We also tried the chicken satay to start but I've had a lot better elsewhere

One of the best kao soy in Chiang Mai. Was on the Michelin guide in 2020/21. Gets pretty crowded during lunch and dinner time so best go a little early. Otherwise there’s a bit of a wait but it’s not long. The beef kao soi is very good and the portion is just right so that you can order other items too. Well worth the trip down to try this.

The place is expensive especially for the small portions. Omelet came out not crispy at all and bland taste. Khao Soi tastes alright. Service quite cold and unfriendly. Don’t understand why people queue up here.
Good food. Fast service. Aside from their Kao Soy which is very good, the omelette is a must try.

there are always a lot of people here, and you need to take a ticket with a waiting number and stand in line. there are seats outside and inside. The atmosphere inside is not very pleasant, since there is a kitchen there, and everyone is fussing around, there is a smell of cooking, and the renovation is not very fresh. Although the environment outside is simple, the plants and fresh air create a more pleasant mood. Keep in mind that many dishes are spicy, especially sausages. I came here 3 times, I like soup with meat. The service varies, sometimes the order is brought quickly, but sometimes you have to remind yourself. once they brought us a plate with a broken edge. Apparently no one is watching this, as well as the napkins and cutlery. If you close your eyes to the small details, then overall it’s delicious. bonus: sale of donuts at the exit of the restaurant, which taste simply wonderful. Unfortunately, they are only sold in sets of 4.
Excellent food and trained staffs Very good service! Must visit place in Chiang Mai.

The food was good, the service was good and the atmosphere was great. I had the beef Khao Soi and the chicken satay. The Khao Soi was very good, but I wish it had more of a coconut flavor. I love the hint of coconut. It was very busy when I came for lunch. Service was pretty good. I would definitely recommend. My Thai lunch companion was not as impressed as I was 🫤 Editing my review for a current visit. I do not know what/why the change, but the food was at best mediocre and the service was horrible.

Yo, foodies! If you're in Chiang Mai and your tummy's rumbling for a taste of heaven, Kao Soi Nimman is your next stop. This no-frills gem in the center of town specializes in one thing, and they do it oh-so-right: Khao Soi! Tips for your visit: - Lunchtime gets busy, so plan accordingly. - Cash is king, but they might accept cards too. - Come hungry, portions are generous! - Prepare for a flavor explosion – your taste buds will thank you! P.S. Don't forget to leave some room for their refreshing butterfly pea tea – the perfect cool-down after your curry feast!

One of our favourite places to eat, we've eaten lunch here 3 times! Long queues but moves fast. Food is fresh and served piping hot. Everything we've tried so far is good including the delicious thai omelette with local veg, khao soi, mango sticky rice, fried pork wanton. Good value for money in a nice, clean environment with fast enough service
Recommend khao soy, the sausage and fermented pork. Sausage can be quite spicy but worth a try. Fermented pork was quite an interested but a very local dish to Chiang Mai
We went at 30 minutes after the opening hour there are already so many q but it was fast to get the table. The food is good with reasonable price. Worth to try!
Kao Soy Nimman was recommended to us by a local and it was so worth it! The service was fast and friendly and the food was delicious. They don't serve alcohol which is totally fine.

Authentic Northern Thai cuisine. Must try the Kao Soy! There’s always a long queue but it moves quite quickly; we were given a table after waiting for less than 10min. Food was amazing and service was quick too. Highly recommend visiting this place if you are in Chiang Mai!

Very creamy and coconut-y Khao soy. The broth is incredible, it’s so flavorful. The beef Khao soy is my recommendation. The beef is so soft and tender, it melts in your mouth. One of the better Khao soy I’ve had for sure. A bit pricey compared to other restaurants.

Fast food style Kao Soy joint. The Kao Soy with multiple meats was outstanding. However, the chicken and veggie curry was practically inedible for a westerner palette … way too hot 😩. Fast and efficient service. Would go back for the Kao Soy!
Amazing food and totally worth the ratings and the Michelin recognition
Pleasant and nice environment...
Conquered another Michelin star restaurant in Chiang Mai! Koy Soy Nimman.
Very good food here! Everything was delicious and service was good.

fast service, good khao soi. maybe waited 5 minutes on a saturday at lunchtime even though it looked very busy. chicken was flavorful, melt in your mouth and not dry. not too spicy. thai omelette was light and crispy but not super flavorful (probably because it was the veggie one); needs the sauce. meat inside the wontons was excellent.
Food was alright. Had Khao Soi, fried chicken and the red ruby dessert. Everything was decent.
Everything we ordered was good. Service was good as well.

This place is a little pricy for Kao Soy but the food is wonderful and a great place to take your guests for experiencing local Kao Soy flavors and atmosphere. I wish they had an option of the bigger portion for all Kao Soys but only for house special. Floor staff were well trained and always were checking each table.
Great Kao Soy here! Wished they gave more curry soup but nothing much to complain really. Highly recommend both of what we ordered!
Overall good Khao Soi, lots of tourists and the location make the price higher others.

Absolutely amazing Kao Soy, I had the Moo Tod variation. It's SUPER busy, but they employ a ticketing system for those waiting which works really well. Food and service was speedy. Great value for money and well deserved Michelin star! (I didn't know they had one until I got there).
Must visit in Chiangmai. Traditional and very taste and creamy Kao Soy
Easy 5 stars. Best Khao soy I’ve had in Chiang mai. Broth is flavourful w umami. Comes out relatively fast. Other dishes like green curry and Tom yum also great.
Tasty and spicy curry noodle Kao Soy. Other special foods from the North of Thailand. Kinda chinese food mixing with thai? Good price equal to service and food quality.
Fancy Khao Soi in Nimman. Pricey but extremely delicious. It's worth paying a bit more and getting a chance to try it. The stewed beef was delicious. Recommend 10/10.
Great Kao Soy, little spicy but tasty. We did wait 5 minutes for table.
Delicious! Its a little spicy for those who can’t take spice.
Went into Kai soy and ordered up almost half the menu. It was amazing. I would definitely recommend this place and come back again next time I’m in Chiang Mai.
Perfect

This restaurant have Michelin’s advise so it is so famous and a lot of people like it. You should come there soon, if not, you need to wait for long. The special dish is Khao Soi and I also love it. Too delicious.
authentic and very delicious
Being Malaysians, I think Malaysian laksa is still better than kao soi. Still, pretty decent meal.
Every time I walk by this place there's a line out the door but yesterday I got there early and it was fantastic
Good
The noodle is as good as my last year visit. The beef khao soy noodle is the best in town for me

Absolutely delicious! Our first Khao Soi: we got the stewed beef (tender and yummy), and the northern pork sausage (fantastic with quite a kick to it, not good if you don't like spicy food!). The combination of the flavourful sauce with the two noodle textures was great. Recommend to anyone.
Normal price and quality. The curry soup is good but the other food is nothing special.

The Khaw Soi was AMAZING! We tried the one with stewed beef - the dish that won the Michelin recommendation, and the one with stewed pork. Both were great! The stewed meat was of the right texture, and the broth was thick and tasty. There were two types of noodles in each bowl - fried and non-fried. Chicken Satay was ok, and so was the Red Ruby. Overall, it’s definitely worth coming here for the Khao Soi!
Odered the beef version, juicy and tender. Will definitely return for more.
service was fast even it is crowded, ordered khao soi with chicken and roselle tea, taste was so yummy but it is abit pricey.

I visited Kao Soy Nimman on a rainy evening and was impressed by the cozy and elegant atmosphere of the restaurant. The place was decorated with wooden furniture, colorful cushions, and lanterns that created a warm and inviting ambiance. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the service was fast and efficient. The menu offered a variety of dishes, but the main attraction was the khao soi, a northern Thai specialty of noodles in a rich and spicy curry broth. but I don't like it very much, because they are a bit salty and fatty for my taste
Overrated and expensive for Thailand standards. The Khao Soy was normal. Nothing too extraordinary. The aircon sitting was limited. Outdoor seating was a bit warm.

Khao Soi is delicious! They have seafood variation, and noodles boiled in normal water (without pork or chicken fat), which is important for me. Costs 60-90 thb (2020 update 85-180 thb, seafood 129). Fast serving, but the only thing - they messed up with my order 5 times, despite I've been there maybe 10-12 times, so around 50% of my visits. Anyway, it's my favorite place in CM.

The best Khao soi I have ever tried, which explains why this place was too crowded. All the dishes are excellent but they are very fatty so you have to take a nap after the meal. Expect a long queue if you are heading at peak times.
One of the best Kao Soy in Chiangmai. I don't recommend the underground mushroom dish as it has a very pungent smell and weird experience eating it but everything else was great!
Curry noodles were great Roast chicken was too dry Beverage was great
Authentic and delicious Kao Soy. Lots of options to choose from. Very popular but not long wait.
Good taste for tourists (local people prefer more spicy), crowded all the time
One of my favorite restaurants on my visit to Thailand, everything here was delicious, especially the Khao soy!

Restaurant is well organized with many servers on hand. They have a large menu with pictures but I ordered beef kao soy. It came out swiftly after ordering. Broth was rich and meat was tender. Seems like there were mostly tourists in here, but the food was good and it was efficient 🤷🏻‍♀️

I stopped by for a mixed Kao soy, which is like kao soy with added seafood. It was delicious, the service was good, and it was a nice atmosphere, bustling but laid back. I would definitely say it was a good place for Thai food.
A bit salty but everything is good

This place is a culinary gem! Their authentic and flavorful Northern Thai khao soi is a must-try, bursting with aromatic spices and tender meat. The cosy ambience and friendly service make it a delightful dining experience. A top-notch spot for foodies!
One of the best khao soi I have ever tasted.

Popular with tourists from South Korea and mainland China. Be prepared to wait 20 - 30 min for a table during weekday lunchtime. The food was all too salty for me personally. The braised pork topping was nice though. Tender and flavourful. Noodle portions are very small for those with single topping. The one with assorted toppings had more noodles. I found the noodles rather soggy but that could be my personal preference (I like my noodles al dente). Soup was alright. Chicken skewers were tender but salty. Dessert with assorted toppings was tasty and refreshing. Outdoor seating can be quite warm. Staff can speak basic English (they could not understand my request not to give me a straw for the dessert)

LOVEEEE the kao soy in this Michelin restaurant here!! My first time in Chiang Mai and this is my first stop, and my first time trying kao soy, had to choose the best for my first! 😙🍜 Everything from the food, ambience, and service was excellent 😍🤩🌟 yellow noodles with the light curry base was so delicious, chicken leg was so soft and easy to eat 🍗😋!! Love the khanom jeen nam ngiao too, yummy though it was VERY spicy for me, even though the staff said it is a liiittlee bit spicy lolz. 😋👍 There are so many selections of food and side dishes to choose from, as well as drinks! Speaking of drinks, they serve it in this cute silver traditional bowl, so unique! Drinks are delicious too, perfect for quenching the spiciness of the food. 🥵🔥 There are plenty of indoor and outdoor seats available, and i love the decorations and music playing in the background! Apart from the many flies eyeing our food, I had a fantastic meal and a great time here!! 😍💖

This is my second visit to this restaurant, and the taste of their Khao Soi remains just as amazing as it was three years ago. I am thoroughly impressed with the consistency in the flavor. Khao Soi's taste is still delicious, and the best part is that it comes at an affordable price, making it truly a great value for money. The restaurant's Khao Soi brings back nostalgic memories of local cuisine. Their secret recipe has been kept intact, maintaining the authentic flavors of Chiang Mai. The aroma of the broth is rich, and the perfect level of spiciness adds to the irresistible allure of this dish. Apart from Khao Soi, their other dishes are also worth trying. Overall, this restaurant offers a good balance of quality and affordability. The service is friendly and efficient, further enhancing the dining experience. In conclusion, I highly recommend this restaurant once again. If you wish to savor authentic flavors of Chiang Mai, this place is an excellent choice. Their Khao Soi continues to be one of my favorite dishes, offering a delightful combination of taste and value. I look forward to revisiting this delightful eatery.
a must-go restaurant. I can wait in line. It's so delicious. The doughnut shop next door is soft and delicious, so please try it.

This isn’t the best khao soi I’ve ever eaten. It’s good though. I had beef khao soi and the broth is delicious. The accompanying onions and pickles were delicious. The beef was really tough though. I still think this is worthy of 5 stars, though because the service was fantastic. The waiters are on it. They were really helpful and the food comes out very quickly.

Ordered 4 diff version of Khai Soy but prefer the chicken because of its tender meat! I also love the convenience of having a call button to order food. Overall, would come back again for their deep and hint of spice coconut flavor broth
The famous restaurant for foreigners have to visit. Kao soy kai is the signature here. The taste is good. They also serve other Northern food as well.

Arrived when it was dinner service and there was a queuing ticket system whereby you are given a number and wait to be called, got in within 10 mins Staffs are friendly and definitely able accommodate to different visiting tourists. Kao Soy is their signature dish with different meat options available; portion is alright if you are also ordering multiple side dishes Moo Bping was also recommended on the menu; different from the ones I’ve known. This is more on the savoury side with a chewier texture [Take Note] Moo Bping takes awhile to be served which they don’t inform beforehand, around 20 mins If you do not have the patience, order something else and don’t shout at service staffs😊
- great food , fast service and wait food a little time
Nice foods, easy to find the restaurant on the street.
My dining companions and I had two bowls each. This is another delicious option for Khao Soi in Chiang Mai.
Best khao soy we had at Chiangmai. ❤️

For Khao Soi with fried pork. The soup is normal. I did not find the special from its taste. The crispy yellow noodles is hard, I put soup into it and waited for a while. The fried pork is very sticky, given just a very very few vegetables (so stinky! ) . Another side dish is fried dumplings, this one is good and nice smell of herbs. The outdoor area have a lot of mosquitoes, the staffs seem to know about this issue but ignorance. So overall, do not recommend.

We got the beef khao soy and the peeled coconut dessert. The beef was delicious and this was the best khao soi I’ve had, recommended to us by our Uber driver. No wonder it’s Michelin recommended! The waiters were hard to flag down unfortunately but not a big deal. For the price of 130 baht it was amazing.
I thought this was great don't know why there were some unpleasing reviews. Cute place also
Not bad but not as good as expected and expensive
Famous for the Khao soi. Quality is okay but on pricey end.

I’ve been living in Chiang Mai for eight years and it’s the first time I’ve come to this restaurant. The Kao Soy chicken was quite a tasty dish, balanced, and to be expected for very good northern Thai food. And if you live in Chiangmai or you’re passing through definitely worth coming here to try the local cuisine.
Food was very delicious. Highly recommended place.

This restaurant appears to be famous among tourists, I came around 11:30 and was lucky to get inside before people came and started the long line waiting. The Khao Soy is just okay the noodles a bit hard for my taste. The spring rolls are surprisingly better than I expected. The dishes seemed not spicy compared to other places. Also I like the bowl they use for drinks, didn't see anywhere else in Chiangmai. So I think Kao Soy Nimman is a nice option for those who want to try local foods that are adjusted to tourists taste, the location is also a plus, well located close to Onenimman.
Curry noodles dishes are outstanding. The egg rolls are light, crisp, and fresh. Coconut and butterfly flower drinks hit the spot. We'll be back to try other items on the menu.
I have tried Khaosoy with beef which one not much spicy since I checked with them just little bit spicy one for me and Mango stricky rice then. Both of them are nice, I enjoyed. You must try it!
There are a lot of varieties of Khao soi with northern food selection. They serve their drinks in a special bowl.
Nice food and good environment. Staff are friendly.
Real good Khao soi. You may find most customers here are tourists. However, still very good food 👍
Good place for tourists
The food was super tasty and filling, super quick and also relatively cheap compared to some of the other restaurants directly surrounding

I actually tried 6 places including the famous kha soy places on my recent trip & this was my favourite, just. I had the deluxe howl & it really is a satisfying meal, very filling. Had the sausage as well which tasted great. Mental note to sit in the main restaurant, I believe I sat in the extended area
I love their pork jerky! (It's hard though)

Hmm, what can I say, I’m not a big fan of khao soy. In fact this is only my second time trying it (after a span of 10 years apart) and I still don’t like it. Luckily the side dishes (northern thai sausage & egg plant salad) are good. Perhaps not for me but those who love khao soy may hv s different view.
The best Khao Soi I had during my trip around Thailand. We came back to this restaurant 2 times (would have been more if we had more time). Definitely recommend.
Curry Noodles is great, and mango with sticky rice too
Nice ambient and cute drinks! Kao soy was really flavoursome! Highly recommended!

First time trying khao soi and this place is one of the best at it. The signature khao soi is really good. We also tried the pork jerky, steamed beef with dipping chilly salt, and mango sticky rice, and all of them was good. Although the price is a bit higher than average, I think it's worth it because the portion is pretty large.
Good food, good service, good location. Pricey at Chiangmai standard
over priced. soup and chicken got cold

amazing khao soi, super refreshing drinks (especially the grass jelly), and delicious mango sticky rice! dined here twice during my short visit and was not disappointed. you may have to flag down a server to place an order and get your check. they were quite busy!

Various northern cuisine. They not just serve Khaosoy but also have other northern dishes. The place is clean and neat with the northern deco style. Giving you warm and cozy vibe. Mix customers both Thai and tourists. Presentation of the foods are good and tasty. Price is alright for what you getting.

Plenty of waiters and waitresses and very polite. The food portion may be somewhat small and spicy for westerners but not too pricey. The taste was nice for non-local Thais yet OK for the locals. There were kinds of Thai dessert available. Recommend for a bit early or late meal time to avoid the long line. Parking was limited to sideways. It was nice to try. Recommended.
Kao Soy is very delicious Nam Prik Org also very delicious All the vegi is fantastic But they are not influence in Eng Also only cash Last thing is coconut water look at the picture
The food is tasty. There are just a couple of vegetarian dishes though. The place is delightful 😍
Good dining experience. Food taste really meets Michelin standard. Worth giving them a try when you visit chiangmai!

I would say the stewed beef Kao Soy was delicious as was the pork but the beef had a much better flavor. The pork kao soy could have used another scoop of broth. Initial arrival was a bit clumsy as they were very busy. Only got one menu but worked through that. Took a few minutes to get waited on but after that the food and the appetizers came out real fast. I would recommend this place if you want to try some Kao Soy. The prices were pretty reasonable for what we ordered.
Overall pretty good. But there are so many other kao soy shops that are just as good.
We were able to walk up and get an outside table on a Friday night. Northern sausage kao soy was incredible. Low prices. Will go back. Highly recommended.
Food is good, portions barely fair, but service is terrible, too much wait and it wasn't even crowded, they forgot my dessert so i had to remind them 25 minutes later, and lastly my glass was dirty

It’s the quality of ingredients that nowhere else can beat. The spices and fresh ingredients are all sourced locally. You can taste the heart and efforts the owner put in to make the best of the best. You pay for what you get. Honest opinion: better than the “best” one.
Nice spot for lunch! Can get very busy depending on the time. I had the Khao Soi stewed beef, it was pretty good! Portions could be bigger though.
Delicious food with nice decorations and good vibes. Worth to try in Chiangmai!

Kao Soy Nimman is one of the uniqueness place serving Khao Soi with plenty of meat to add on for topping. Not only the Khao Soi availble here, they also served the Northern Thai’s dishes and Thai sweet. The bow of Khao Soi is good with the light soup but intense in aroma of curry paste, the soup is quite sweet not to spicy even adding some chili to it. Khao Soi noodle a bit soft not to tender, deep fried noodle is not crispy. Chicken is tender and hard but the beef is fine. The herbal drinks and Thai sweet are recommended here, very amazing. This is a good place to enjoy the Northern Thai food, if you getting bored of Khao Soi.
Great food at a total local spot.
My favorite khao soi ever! Super bowl was indeed super!! I will be back. (Come early, it gets busy!)
Wanted to try a couple of must try foods in Chiangmai and this bowl had 3 of the items from the list!
Delicious but expensive
Savory kao soy with soup base thats aromatic and not too thick to slurp. Highly recommend to add other meat topping into your kao soy dish esp Chicken!!!!!

Visited after taxi driver recommended it and so glad we did! Food was great, excellent and attentive service and lovely atmosphere all for a very good price. We paid less here than in some restaurants in the more touristy areas and for Michelin recommended food!
Visited this place because of the hype, food was so so we tried much better places in CNX. Michelin plate adds crowds and sets expections high, however we experienced something else
Definitely one of the best places in Thailand for a foodie. A must-visit
Great khao soi! Had to wait for a table as the place is very popular, but it was worth the wait.
Over salted tom yum, special dish recommend finished;(

Good khao soi, but for the price I expected better: it could be fresher and the flavors more distinct. It didn't look much like the pictures. One sitting area looks nice, but they sat me in a side area that had no ambiance whatsoever. The food came out very quickly.
You have to get the queue number for reservation. Despite some queue, the food is quick and yummy. Nice decorated restaurant. ⭐⭐⭐⭐ 195 Big Bowl Mixed Khao Soi
Can't believe all North food is here
You would never find this place in Chaing Mai. But a local hot spot for sure. Lots of young folks. Unlike myself

A Khao soy shop that produces magic with and without Khao soy dishes. Firstly the Khao Soy is the best one I've tasted in Chiang mai with thicker curry sauce. We further enjoyed the other dishes. Grilled sausage, beef curry, sales vege pork ribs soup, vege and dip and few more! Each one of them delicious. At some corner of the very thick menu lies a picture of the crab brullee. It's like baked uni but for a fraction of the price. Pretty random find but just wow. And a testament to Chiang Mai's culinary standards. Will return!
Loved this place, great ambience and very very tasty food. A must visit when you are in Chiang Mai. I ordered kao soy, tom yum soup (shrimp), fried chicken, coconut water and a dessert.
Good as usual, but the portion is smaller than before

A bit disappointed in this place after the high recommendations. The kao soy was sort of bland and the portion was very small, I will give it another try before I leave and maybe change my review but we had wonton and 2 different kao soy dishes and both of us felt underwhelmed. To its credit the service is very fast and the atmosphere is nice. the chairs are all low stools so it's a little uncomfortable.

Very good Kao Soy in a lovely patio. While likely not the best Kao Soy in Chiang Mai or the most authentic, this place is worth a lunch stop while walking around Nimman. Seat in the cool patio and have it with their signature coconut drink
Not as nice as the vegetarian cow soi I got somewhere in Chiang Rai, but not bad. Be careful of the beverages in silver containers as some of them taste very healthy.
Good quality northern food. Fast service. Have returned many times when in Chiangmai.

Delicious Kao Soy, and the vegetarian version with gorgeous mushrooms! There is a vegetarian option for many (if not most) of the menu categories. When we arrived, there were six groups ahead of us but because they are so organized here, we didn’t wait long at all for a table at lunchtime.
It’s normale price and cheaper than Europe price. But it’s delicious. And Michelin!! Curry it’s tasty.

This restaurant has an awesome atmosphere with a huge outdoor area and lots of fairy lights. We ordered way too much food, but it was all delicious and certainly one of the best Khao Sois we ate on the trip. No wine available, just beer. A decent selection of vegetarian options too (including for khao soi).
Awesome Khao Soi. Great service. Will go back to try some of the other menu options
Kao Soy with beef is so so good! Highly recommend!
My local Chiang Mai guide brought me here for lunch and it was excellent food and service.
Went to try their Kao Soy. Noodles exceptional, broth mediocre.

Not a good experience. We are in Chiang Mai in Nimman district for quite some time and only now we went to Kao Soy for the first time. First weird thing is that they close already at 8pm and we were rushed to leave the place as we arrived just after 7pm for s dinner.
