Must eat noodle in Chiangmai. Shop was so busy. We were lucky to get here before 19:30 because the restaurant will not serve for guests coming after this time.
Reasonably priced in a convenient neighborhood. Could not expect better
It tasted like Laksa. Very nice :) 👍🏼
Bit touristy, sometimes u need to wait a while, but really good food. Except traditional kao soi I also recommend eggplant salad and grilled sour pork with egg in banana leaves (see photos)
Perfect. If you ask me to pick best restaurants in chiang mai, I would recommend here.
Large variety of dishes. Delicious food. Well priced. They have these buttons to call your waiter. They respond instantly.
So good!
Kao Soy is super delicious! Also the satay is wonderful too!

Ordered "northern style spicy minced pork salad wrapped in crispy wontons" - they tasted pretty good but there were big chunks of blood cubes, intestines etc in there which I'm not really accustomed to as a westerner, I kind of expected just pork mince meat as opposed to alot of organs.. I also ordered the "northern style pork curry made with peanuts, garlic and ginger" which tasted ok but was quite mild flavoured and watery + half of the curry was fat and skin (again I kind of expected just pork meat - as shown in the picture in their menu). Considering this wasn't a cheap meal, I was overall disappointed in the quality. To make matters worse, I ordered delivery to my hotel and was sent no cutlery so I had to run around to 7-11 to ask for a tiny plastic spoon, made for stirring coffee". Food was cold by the time I got round to opening it up. Dont think i'll be ordering from this place again!
Incredible taste of Rice noodles with spicy pork sauce!! Northern Thai curry noodle with beef was also nice. But the noodle is quite too thick. Very good and quick service. Price was reasonable.
Great place with nice food. Great price. And large quantities. Place is cool and hip and always busy but never saw long lines. Bathrooms leave much to be desired.

My Khao Soi had the worst beef in it that i ever had in Asia and it was cold too. Staff wasn't friendly and didn't even ask why we didn't eat it after it was paid. It is very cheap, but that doesn't make it better. Can't recommend it at all.
The kao soy is okay but not the best one

Such a great lunch spot! Sure it’s busy, sure it’s a bit modern, but who can complain about a kickass bowl of Khao Soi in clean digs? Loved the endless options for proteins - with such a rich and flavorful broth having mushrooms instead of meat for once was actually surprisingly fabulous.
Ordered the khaosoi with chicken. Broth was a bit too sweet and thin for my liking.
The khao sok pork dish is so yummy, spicy and flavorful. Thai iced tea was excellent, perfect balance of sweetness. Mango sticky rice was so good, hot rice, but the mangoes were too
Absolutely loved the food. The garden is really nice as well. If you go to Chang Mai, you absolutely need to taste the Kao Soy.
Nothing special than air con Khao Soi with variety choices of meat

modern take on Khao soi - with about 10 different options for meat to have it with -I tried the Thai sausage Khao soi which was nice. It is about double the price of a bowl at other local restaurants at 80 thb. However the soup and noodles weren’t very nice in my opinion - too soft and lacked flavour.
Delicious khao soi and other dishes too! You won’t be disappointed. But be prepared to wait if you arrive during peak hours.
Taste was ok. Very foreigner like. Doesn’t have much chilli. Have to order extra. Most of the food doesn’t include the actual chilli. Foreigner taste. But the taste is still ok

Went here again and again during our month in Chiang Mai. Lots of variety for khao soi protein, from Thai sausage, to shrimp, pork loin, and omelette to name a few. We tried the laab, spring rolls, and tempura shrimp appetizers as well. All were ok, but the khao soi is the star!

This is one of the best places for Khao Soi. They make their own special yellow noodle served Al dente. Nam Prik Noom tastes excellent but spicy. People with low spice tolerance be warned. Love their special drinks especially their coconut that can be eaten as a whole. Good and quick service. The queue was long but the turnover is quick. Recommended Foods: Any Khao Soi (if you have huge appetite, go for Super Khao Soi), Mixed Appetizer Platter ออเดิร์ฟเมือง, Khang Hed Torp (แกงเห็ดถอบ)
Friendly staff. I went in the afternoon with a 15 minute wait. Got the combo bowel. My stomach may not agree with the spiciness but it's worth it.
The best khaosoi in Chiang Mai 😁
Good place to dine :) the minus will be that the stuff does not speak english but the food is great . For non spicy lovers do say not spicy
Not a place to go for original Khao soi. The taste is suitable for tourists who cannot bear real spiciness of Thai food. All is acceptable but the soft noodle that is much thicker than average.
Good khao soi noodle soup but the price is a little high.
Khao Soi with variety of meat selections. cute place.
Tried three most famous curry noodle and it really deserves it. Price is also reasonably cheap
Please don't miss this! If you are the one who love local food especially noodle
Very nice atmosphere, tasty local food, mostly meat, spicy...;) Few vegetable options too! Interesting way of preparing omelette. Yummie passion fruit juice:P
Food is great but take some time to going out
Beef Khao Soi is okay, not the best that you can find in Chiang Mai (meat was not tender enough). Service and ambience was superb.

Lovely place, khao soi was very delicious! I had the pork one and my sister tried the sausage one - both were equally very good although the sausage one is a bit spicy. I also ordered the satay and it is highly recommended too, the chicken was very juicy. Really enjoyed my first khao soi experience in Chiang Mai!

Forgettable and average khao soi. It has a very nice decor, comfortable and clean environment. There's indoor air conditioned seating and outdoor seating. Even seating outdoors, there's no pesky mosquitoes. There are many wait staff and they are attentive and helpful. There's a toilet and free wifi. However when it comes to the food, it's mediocre and i have had better khao soi in the basement of a fresh market and much cheaper too. The khao soi here is served in a porcelain bowl with the pickle, onion and lime wedge in a separate metal dish. One taste of the noodle, the soup was not hot(merely warm), noodle was too soft and the curry tasted a tad too sweet(not sour enough even with the lime). I ordered the thai omelette khao soi, the omelette itself was good and the fried egg noodles on top of the bowl were perfectly crispy and crunchy so props for those. Overall forgettable khao soi and it was more expensive than average (starts at 69 thb. I have had better khao soi at 40 thb). I went past the kitchen and noticed a big vat of curry boiling away on the stove so it doesn't make sense that it's merely warm. I then ordered a dessert(water chestnut with rubies in iced coconut milk) 40 thb. It came in a plastic container with a plastic straw and spoon stuck in the container. I try to avoid single use plastics and always have with me my own cutlery. Such an upscale place and they use single use plastics and chopsticks. Disappointing. (Returning the plastics will only be thrown in the bin so even worse)
Food was good but a tad spicy. Pricing was ok. Ambiance was nice
Love this place. The seafood pad Thai is incredible!

Conveniently located in famous Nimman Street. This northern style cuisine offers variety of dishes that garantee you will leave Chaingmai with satisfaction of northern food craving. However I personally would loved that some dishes to be more authentic taste rather than adapted for foreigners tastes.
It's was ok not that great..
Excellent food, definitely come back again!
Khao soi specialty with many choices of meat to choose apart from normal chicken khao soi. Mild taste and easy to eat.
The best local curry noodles I've ever had!! Must try.
Khao Soi tastes really good. They’re fast in serving and cooking. Khao Soi costs around 69-89 baht, depends on what menu do you order.

I ate here about 6 times in the two weeks I was in Chiang Mai, I just couldn't get enough. The Khao soi beef is incredible. Staff are very friendly and attentive and the food comes out very quickly. Hip decor makes this a must do when you are in the area.

Good place for Khao Soi in Nimman. Not the best Khao Soi I tried but quite decent and location is good. Also has many other Northern dishes to try out. Seating are all under the shades but in summer it’s hot.
This restaurant is so cute and the kao soy is amazing!!
fantasy northern thai food

Kao Soi chicken is the best here. Chicken satay is quite lean but the taste isn’t that good. They don’t have the parking lot so walking or biking would be the easiest way to get here. But if you’ve got a car, you can park it nearby at the roadside.
Tasty kao soi place. It was quite busy and the service was pretty slow.

Take note that the name of the restaurant is spelt Kao Soi, not Khao Soi. We were confused initially as there was another restaurant across the road also selling Khao Soi. Our first Khao Soi and it was tasty, though nothing wow. Place had a nice ambiance.

Beautiful setting with decent khao Soi. My favorite part about Khao Soi Nimman is the variety of proteins to choose from. Fair warning: this place can get pretty crowded with selfie-taking tourists. Especially during the lunch hour.

Service is pretty slow. Even as a single guest, it took 45 minutes to get my bowl of Kao Soy. There was very little broth & even less noodles. And it was not even hot. Tasted pretty good but I was very disappointed. 🙁
One of the beat KhaoSoi in Chiang Mai. ^^
Great vibe, cool Nimman location and of course, yummy Khao Soi. Be sure to check out other items on the menu too, like the really good eggplant salad!

The place is quite big, nice and staff is friendly. Food is okay. Khaosoi has lots of topping you can choose which is different from other restaurants, the taste not to spicy for foreigners but for Thai can be more spicy ;))
One of the best Khao Soi in nimman area! Love this place!
Excellent Khaosoi, probably the best in time.

What a great place! But forget the place, the FOOD IS AWESOME! It's our first Kao Soy ever and while I can't compare it to other places yet..the only thing I can suggest is GO FOR IT! We had the one with fried pork and sausage and we are speachless.
The menu is well designed and easy to read, also there are many choices for Khao Soi. However, this Chiang Mai staple is more expensive at this place than most other restaurants.
Great Northern Thai food and a good price. Very relaxed. My favourite restaurant in Chiang Mai (want to just keep going back here).
Delicious food, good service. Unfortunately, it's uncomfortable if it rains.
Pretty good khao soi, but much more expensive than better options I've tried in Chiang Mai.
It's taste not bad . Just feel like try the same as the other local restaurant.
Very tasty, not very spicy, relax setting and great value!
I waited long time for table and food. Anyway, food is yummy.
ข้าวซอยไก่ is delicious and you can add toppings.
A little bit more expensive compared to a lot of khao soi restaurants, but definitely worth it. They have a wide variety of Khao Soi dishes. The taste is mild comparatively.

My first Khao soi! Delicious curry broth paired with chewy egg noodles! I ordered the stewed beef Khao soi and even though it was extra yummy, I can just eat the noodles with the broth alone! Ordered the Thai omelette as well but I was too big for 1 person to finish 😆. Thank you for letting my taste buds experience new flavour!

Khaosoy itself is ok, a lot less spicy compared to other khaosoy places. Im Thai, the overall taste is quite bland for me, but I assume tourists might like it. Chicken satay is very bland.😅 Good service. (if not rushing hours ofc) Price is normal, portion is normal, not too much or too less.

Soup was not hot and neither was the chicken thigh, feels like they just drop the chicken in the soup before serving the khao soi. What’s a good bowl of noodles if the soup is not hot? The meat isn’t marinated in the soup or so tender it just breaks off the bone. I’ve had better khao soi, made the mistake of coming here in convenience of distance, I can do better, we can do better.

For a Michelin recommended restaurants, the Khao Soi wasn't as good as one would expect. The restaurant is very crowded. The seats are extremely uncomfortable. The tables are placed very tightly. Food portions are small especially for Khao Soi.

Very busy restaurant with good service and delicious Khao Soy options. Even though busy no one ever needed to wait for a table. The taste was good but maybe average for many other areas in the north for comparison.

Good food but waiter did not understand our order. We repeated 4 times to get water and they kept forgetting. We also tried to order Mango Sticky Rice but they told us that the cuisine is close, we should have been alerted and asked whether we wanted a dessert when we made the first order. Overrated

Came for early dinner Ordered two curry noodle, fried spring roll, egg omelette and stir fry vegetable. 1) staff got distracted while taking order, client need to repeat few times. No smile on every staff. 2) apart from the small portion of those noodle, those fried food (spring roll and Omelett) were ruined by the think powder. Overall, super low CP value and not worth for Michelin.

The best Kao Soi I've had by far. The food and atmosphere of the restaurant is exceptional But more importantly the staff are incredible. I forgot to take my change and left in a rush. I came back and the staff were incredible honest and helpful. Great business, makes me want to come back. Super grateful!

What a disappointment! The Kao Soi I had ordered wasn't available, so I opted for the shrimp one. The shrimps looked like they came straight from the refrigerator. The dish was very small and testless. Overall, it's very expensive for what it is. The Michelin years are long gone
The soup was only lukewarm, and the meat was almost cold and felt undercooked. The spring rolls and vegetables we ordered was okay. Overall very dissapointing
The beef noodle worth to try, beef so tender. Beef itself make the khao soy taste great. Recommend to order this instead others. Its hard to find parking around this area so better be prepared.

Not sure why this place was rated as popular. Service was horrible. After was seated, we wondered if we had to walk to a place to ask for menu. We had to flag one of the many service people around to get the menus. Waited another 10 minutes, flagged down a service person, so we could order foods. Same when we wanted more beers. After 15m12s, we received foods. Khao Soi was okay. Pork curry did not taste curry, was full of fat. Never tasted curry that bad in Thailand. This place would not be my choice again in the future.

BEWARE!! I had horrendous food poisoning from Kao Soy Nimman that lasted three days. I hadn’t eaten anything else prior or after visiting so it was without doubt from here. I ordered the beef khao soi and chicken satay as a side. It was very busy when I visited so must be a serious issue with food preparation or storage in the kitchen. Usually I would assume a busy restaurant with high turnover would be safe. Certainly not in this case!!
Very good food, guys. Khao Soy is a must try when visiting Chaing Mai. This is a very good place to do so. ✨️
Have been in Thailand for a few days and this is the only restaurant that disappointed me. We ordered the signature needle and a few other dishes. Doesn’t taste good.

I was diappointed with chicken green curry cost around 150 baht. There were 3 small piece of chicken and small fracture piece of chicken bone in the soup. The tase was not like any good green curry I ever had before. Kao Soy was also not very good. Please improve quality and check amouth of food carefully before serving.
The food was disappointing and overly greasy. The noodles were bland, the fried chicken was dry, and the spring rolls tasted stale. Poor value for money — I won’t be coming back.
It looks great, but all their food has MSG and they cannot cook without it. Unfortunately, MSG is a neurotoxin and a chemical that you don’t want in your body.
It’s been a long time since I didn’t enjoy a Kao Soy that good. And the garlic shrimps… Thank you so much, keep being awesome and delicious 🙌🏻

Creative Khao soi, be it in chicken, beef, mushroom, soft shell crab, etc. 1 bowl is not enough! Other dishes are also tasty, we enjoyed it, manage your time well to come here, first come first serve.

Kao Soy Nimman, located in Chiang Mai’s trendy Nimman area, is renowned for its rich and flavorful Khao Soi, a Northern Thai coconut curry noodle soup. The restaurant offers a variety of protein options, including chicken, beef, pork, seafood, and Chiang Mai sausage, allowing diners to customize their bowls. The broth is praised for its depth and balance, combining creamy coconut milk with aromatic spices, and the noodles are perfectly cooked, complemented by crispy fried noodles on top. In addition to Khao Soi, the menu features other Northern Thai specialties and refreshing herbal drinks like gardenia and pennywort.
Huge touristic vibes, as you see most of foreign faces here. Tried the Khao Soi beef, it’s decent and medium portion while it claimed to be “big bowl”. Overall nothing special and def overpriced.
Crispy toppings, broth that’s less sweet but still gently rich, chewy noodles with a satisfying bite, but Northern Thai sausage is average
Average, nothing special. Maybe the non-vegetarian food will be better. Khao Soi and a chilli dip plate. Would come back if I'm hungry but wouldn't go out of my way

The food was great, my family and I went to the restaurant during our trip to Chiang Mai! The food itself was exceptionally great, the flavors of the curry could not be imagined as it was so good! Overall, the place is very neat and cozy.

We got two Kao soy noodles, one beef, one pork. The soup was great, but both meats were just fats. Jackfruit salad was okay. Calamari tempura was a bit oily. A few things here and there but the food was good overall.
Watch out. I think a lot of MSG. I was sick for a day after. But the place was lovely and it was delicious

This review might seem spiteful, but I truly had a very poor experience here that is likely to be reflective of the general quality of the restaurant. Kao Soy Nimman is a Michelin bib gourmand place which has definitely earned it much fame among tourists. We had to line up for about 30 minutes before being given a table, which isn’t a problem in itself. However, ONCE we got inside and placed our orders (one bowl of khao soi and one omelette), it took 40 minutes before the khao soi arrived. We made several requests to the staff about where our food was, but no one ever seemed to be able to definitively help. The khao soi took 40 minutes to arrive, but we waited about 70 minutes for the omelette and it never came. We ultimately decided we had spent too long in the restaurant, asked the waitress if we could cancel our omelette request (to which she kindly said yes), paid up and left. As for the khao soi, it was extremely bland and watered down, and the meat was tough and chewy. I have since eaten at Khao Soi Maesai and Khao Soi Lung Prakit Kad Kom (both Michelin bib gourmand places too), and their khao soi was incomparably better and the quality of the meat was far superior too. Not to mention, the prices at this restaurant are 3x those at the other two, but for what reason? This isn’t an agenda-driven review by any means, but simply an honest reflection of what I experienced. I hope it is helpful, especially to those of you who are considering visiting on a tight time schedule - you will not miss anything important by skipping this place.

Food was amazing. Bit spicy, but that is normal. Service was awful. Restaurant is open till 9 pm. Arrived at 8:15 and got our table after 10 min. The waiter already told us to only choose a Koa Soy. Kinda rude, but alright. Then when we were sitting at our table we had to order in 2 min while the waiter was looking at us the whole time. Quite nerving. We got our food, which was delicious, but while we were eating we suddenly had to pay. This is very rude while you are eating. So service was bad, but food delicious.

Just eaten the legendary kao soy(northern Thai curry noodle) it's indeed better than southern Thai boat noodle on my preference Some staff are great some are u know .. see luck Atmosphere very great indeed.. love it Bowl is big 🫰🏻 Order kao soy moo + salt& pepper chicken + 2 drink From 🇸🇬

I visited this place expecting a pleasant meal, but unfortunately, it fell far below expectations. The food was poorly prepared and lacked the authentic flavors that this region is known for. On top of that, the service was inattentive and unwelcoming, making the experience even more disappointing. I had hoped for a memorable meal, but this left a bad impression instead. There are plenty of better options in Chiang Mai that offer both great food and friendly service. I cannot recommend this place based on my visit.

Kao Soy is always good here. It is air conditioned. Never afraid of hot temperature in Chiang Mai. But it is expensive than other places. it is real tourist place. You get what you pay for. Don't worry.

Arrived and checked the menu, it had a « vegan » labeling for some of the meals. So I waited 30 mins in line just to be seated and then told that they have no vegetarian options and all soups have chicken in them. The waiter was basically laughing at my face. Really bad experience. Also there are cockroaches crawling all over the place. Do not recommend.

Came from a recommendation from a friend. Overhyped in our opinion. Had better food elsewhere for much cheaper. Draws a lot of people especially Asian tourists, mango sticky rice was amazing but hard to get that wrong. Line moves fast (get a ticket) Hardly any vegetarian options as the broth is chicken based.

The Khao Soi was average. Their stewed beef shank was horrendous, having a really tough texture, not soft at all. Northern style sausage was not bad. There were plenty of empty tables available, at least 4 (refer to my photos), when we arrived, but we weren’t seated until 20 mins later which shows they just aren’t very efficient with managing things. Also, there were 4-5 employees wearing orange shirts whose job is to take orders from customers (you can’t scan a QR code to order by yourself) but only 1-2 of them were working and the other employees were just slacking off. So when I gestured to have my order taken, one of them would look at another, expecting their colleague to take responsibility and that repeated a few times, and so I had to wait a few minutes to even have someone come over and take our order. Also, their queuing system is not clear at all. There should a sign at the entrance that clearly states that you need to collect a blue ticket from one of their employees. Overall, I thought the food was quite average and not worth what you pay for (a bill for 2 came to 525 baht, and the service wasn’t great, and you will most likely have to queue to eat here, and so I definitely would say it’s not worth your time and energy to eat such average food.
Nice atmosphere, good food, super clean and nice pleasant staff Congrats

Curry noodle is nice the gravy is nice a bit like watery Mee Rebus gravy but more spicy. The bamboo shoots soup is actually more spicy and nice beware of fish bone though. The desert is a pass too normal.
SImply a good Khao soi restaurant. Sometimes simplicity is better than complexity.

After previously visiting this restaurant 7 years ago, we were excited to see that it still exists and the Khao Soi is still as delicious as ever! Come a little earlier to avoid a long wait, as it gets busy in the evening. If there is a line, it moves pretty fast and definitely worth the wait!
The place was just amazing , clean and quiet. The staff was more than welcoming. The fooood was just a next level ❤️
Food just looked good. There are more better price and better taste food in this area

My family and I visited there and did not see anything special there. The Tom yum khom I had was not delicious. Spicy sausage was not tasty as well as the rice noodle. We paid over 1800 Bath and nothing good، while we had much delicious meal elsewhere for 600/700. We had a better Tom yum and many different things in small shops in the village where we stay. We did not like it at all. We will never go there again and will never recommend it to anyone else at all.

Overrated. The Khao Soi portion was so tiny, I thought they forgot to add broth actually. Too expensive considering the tiny size. It was tasty though, but no difference to any street vendor. Waiter was rude and pretended to not understand when I asked if it's prepared with MSG and just left.

Arrived to a deli style number queue system, missed our number by 1 so had to requeue. Known for kai Sao was pretty basic light on flavour, pork stew was devoid of pork and beef dish was topside and not succulent as the menu suggested, dry and tough worst dish I've had in thailand.
Cool place food was good and reasonably priced. Would recommend. It is a unique way to get serviced and was kind of confusing.

Be careful! We had really bad food poisoning from here. I would not recommend coming here for that reason. I'm sharing this to prevent people from experiencing what we had experienced with food poisoning.

They charge for limes, etc. That should tell you the kind of place this is. 155 baht for the small beef khao soi. Mushy noodles, very little curry/gravy. The nam prik ong is fine (imagine a piquant bolognese). Some of the vegetables are "gloopy", like okra. Those are interesting to chew on (and to try to swallow eventually). It's more "khao suck" than khao soi.
The very best Khao Soi I've tried in Chiang Mai. This place is very popular and not that large so get here early.

The food is good, but I wouldn't say it's worth the price. I had the kao soi with sausage, and sure it was good, but expensive and I was still hungry after. I also ordered the curry pork to-go because I was still hungry, again, it was good but not worth the price, especially considering it doesn't come with vegetables. I also made sure to order sticky rice but they still gave me steamed rice, I didn't notice until I got home :(

I had a very tasty Khao Soi with Thai sausage (but they have about 10 different variations, both veggie and with meat) and some shrimp tempura. Both dishes arrived within 5 minutes after my order even though the place was packed full, props for that. A point reduction for the portion size of the Khao Soi though. I‘m a big guy, but usually I‘m full after one Khao Soi, not so here, it felt like half a portion and with very little soup. Oh, and when I wanted to order a beer they told me beer was sold out (at 7pm), which I found was strange… Both dishes cost about 120 baht each.

This seems to be a social Media made hot Spot! Food is Dissapointing! I had a much better Koa Soy in a local shop the other day for half the Price. I had it with beef5, which was mainly fat. Nothing special at all but random Koi Soy dish. Service is quick, because there are many people.

I’m not sure why there were so many good reviews of the Khao Soi. The dish was tasteless, small, had no vegetables, and very little chicken. There is MUCH, MUCH better Khao Soi available in the old city area of Chiang Mai. The pork dish was okay, as were the vegetables. The service was attentive.

Very delicious. I've ordered ~ 10 times now - always Khao Soi with Chicken + 1 Chicken thigh. Price is around ฿140 including delivery in the area. Sometimes Grab offers promotions. The delivery time is lightening fast, and has always been faster than the app estimates. This is a great Khao Soi, which is a most try Northern Thailand dish. Thanks!
Khao Soi is suprisingly good, strong and unique in flavour We ordered a few side dishes(spring roll, fried egg, north thai sausage) and all was good. The coconut milk dessert is very good too!
We sat outside and ordered the beef Kao Soi!! It was delicious and definitely one of the best Kao Soo I ever had. I didn’t take a photo but we ate it with the egg omelette which I 10/10 recommend

This restaurant was recommended to me by a Thai friend when I wanted to taste authentic flavours in a luxury setting and they delivered! Everything about the experience was amazing. Service is great. Lots of different places where you can sit. The highlight for me was definitely getting the coconut water in a steel bowl that just looked so beautiful. My noodles were delicious. I really like that they had vegetarian options! I also had an eggplant dish that was YUM. I cried a little because it was spicy but I couldn't stop eating.

Many has misunderstood, the star of this restaurant is definitely not the khao soy, it is the omelete with pork and the grilled pork and the various desserts. The khao soy was just meh but the rest is chef's kiss. If you are entering the restaurant sitting on the left outdoor area seems to be cooler. Right side has no ventilation and be prepared to be soaked!
Worth a visit good food not less than 200 baht per person
Khao Soi (curry noodles) were delicious. The ambience is also nice, and its not rare to see people taking photos. Quality dish at reasonable prices
I'd say it is a bit overrated. The noodles of the khao soi had a soggy texture for both bowls we ordered. The service and the atmosphere was good though

After all the fanfare about this place, I was disappointed - I ordered the signature chicken dish. There were not much in the way of noodles, seemed there were more of the crunchy ones on top. The chicken drumstick was fine. I have had better soup in food courts to be honest.
Food (khao soi) was decent, but the service was indifferent at best. They brought us the food then immediately demanded that we pay, and were quite rude about it.

It's reputation is better than the service. Went last year and was impressed. We were a group of 4. They forgot my drink, my partner's satay arrived after the others finished their meals, and we watched one of the cooks clean her ears then serving food (no hygienic gloves). Definitely won't be going back.

The Khao Soi is nice. Other food is ok. But the service is terrible. This place closes at 21:00, but the waiters are reluctant to serve since 20:30. We pushed the calling bell for several times and no one responded. One of the waiter just held the bill and standed next to our table before we even finished. The waiter took order took the wrong order and refused to apologize for it. When we argued with him, he asked “do you want me to pay for it?”

Wow best khao soi in Chiang Mai. Get the kao soi stewed beef and the grilled beef. Skip the drinks because they are half ice anyway. Great value for this flavor. When arrive, get queue number from the staff and wait to be called. It was crowded when we went but they serve fast.
The Best Food place in Chiang Mai with the best Kao Soy in town.

Fair prices. Good food. Fast service. Lots of customers. The Kao Soy comes extremely fast but you will wait on other foods to be delivered. Was given an incorrect bill probably due to the high amount of customers. So check your bill for proper charges!

Came here for lunch on our last day in Chiang Mai. Wow. Well organized table service with a line out front. Meal came quickly. Exceptional quality. Must visit. On the Michelin list for a reason. I wish I had ordered two bowls and not because the portions were small. Just sorry the meal had to end.

I didn't have to wait long since I was number one in line, but compared to other famous restaurants, the food came out slowly. The broth was lukewarm and the noodles were undercooked... I don't think I'll be back for a second time.
Love their Kao Soy, they have an extensive menu, but I can't resist traditional Kao Soy with beef.

the one that still open in the night to eat khao soi, the khao soi soup just like curry, but very delicious! the beef also so tender, its proved the chicken satay, must eat with the sauce because the sauce is sweet n sour will balance the taste. the spring roll just so so. but the outdoor one is too dark, better if there are more lights.

I like the place, I like the food. We went twice. I didn’t like the beef so much, it was weird texture (western taste) 😉 the chicken was better My bf took the chicken satay. Delish!! Perfectly cooked and juicy and the pork curry, the sauce is very good. Sometimes there is a line sometimes not. The place is cute, but you don’t go there for the ambiance! Fast lunch or dinner. Service is fast and ok.

Kao Soy was delicious but the service was horrible. Nothing on the menu was available except for the kao soy, so that was really annoying. They said we could get dessert but then never brought it. We asked where our dessert was and they said kitchen was closed. No variety in drinks. They took so long to take our order.

2 of us ate here on the 18-01-2024. We were told to choose a table and we sat down just before 8pm. We rang the service bell to place our order. We ordered nam prik het gap pak (not the actual name of the dish but I'm farang) along with one steamed rice. The order arrived a nice selection of vegetables but they were limp and tasteless where they had been cooked to long and they werent seasoned. The dip was OK but didn't taste fresh and was not very spicy. The waiting staff bought sticky rice first of all when we ordered steamed so we sent it back, then they bought out to 2 steamed rice where we ordered one so we sent one back. At 8.15 we were told that the restaurant was closing and we should order now if we wanted anything else, the restaurant advertises that it closes at 9pm,, customers continued to come in for a further 25 minutes and were given tables (reluctantly) at this.point we decided to ask for the bill, 15 minutes later the bill had not arrived so we asked again, a further 5 minutes and the bill arrived. I put cash in the holder and waited and 10 minutes later we called someone over and paid our bill. Nobody was overseeing the lazy waiters all of them young men. This is the first time.i have not left a tip in Thailand. I was recommended the khao soi here so I will go back band try it but if then owners are reading this they need to address the experience before more negative reviews roll in. The spicy sausage was very nice.

When you have the best khao soi ever, you can treat customers however you want. When you’re just another place among many with decent khao soi you might want to treat them like you appreciate them. Instead this is a get you in/get you out food mill with zero customer service. PLENTY of places in Chiang Mai with good khao soi who appreciate your business.

Food was nice. Tried to order dessert 30 minutes before they closed but the guy ignored us and then they said no for some reason? Then we tried to pay, and they refused our card even though the people behind us paid with card. So I had to get a Grab back to our hotel to get cash, and they didn't even apologise for the inconvenience. I think they only wanted to accept cash so that they could pocket it.

We went here around lunch-time just because it was the closest by place that did kao soy. We had to wait fifteen minutes or so before we could be seated as the place was packed (the reason, I guess, is that it has had Michelin recommendations in the past). It was our first time trying kao soy, so I can't tell if it's authentic but it's good. Crispy noodles on top and a slightly spicy curry sauce.

Would absolutely recommend this spot if you’re visiting and want to try some excellent Kao Soy. Both the meat and vegetarian noodles were excellent and the setting is great. As an added bonus it’s a fun neighborhood to explore and worth visiting if you’ve only explored the old city.

We ordered Kao Soi and Tom Yum for take away. The noodles were fine, but the soup....was just full of small lemongrass or ginger pieces, so it was impossible to eat without picking smth out of every spoon. It was my first experience ordering something at a restaurant and not at food stall and to be honest I was disappointed :(

The best thing about this place is the lively, breezy space. The khao Soi was good but nothing special, the green curry had barely any chicken; had more blood cubes which wasn’t at all disclosed in the description so you had to know that was what it was in the photo. The mushroom dip with veggies was only ok. The veggies seemed boiled. The beef skewers were terrible - more fat than meat. The dinner service was poor - felt like they were churning through the crowd and they paid no attention to details, such as brought water but no cups, brought the check before the last dish was served. They need basic training unfortunately.
Used to be our go to for Khao Soi. Our Khao Soi on our last visit slopped together my beef Khao Soi looked more like tiny slivers of shredded beef. Will try again at a later date.
we found two hairs in noodle local food restaurant is better than kao soi noodle the manager didn't say sorry I don't know how it got Michelin awards lol~ owner should be more care about store hygine

Liked the flavor but my Kai soy was served Luke warm and the chicken leg ice cold. Sent it back and they nukes it but still came back cold. They seem too busy to really care Great price and cute place though closes kinda early
Very flavorful food. Meat was soft and juicy. Great value! Ambience is very chill and relaxing.

We went based on the positive reviews. The atmosphere is pleasant, and the service is pretty good. Prices are fair and the food is OK. I had the "Super Khao Soy" and my wife had a pork noodle soup. We shared a fried spring roll appetizer. One big upside is that they actually delivered the appetizer first which is unusual for here. The downside is the spring rolls were a bit oily, but they were quite crispy. We thought this place was OK, but not a favorite here.

Our last restaurant when being in Chang Mai.... And we simply LOVED IT! I've read and also hears that it was built for tourists and so on... But I definitely don't understand why. True, the decor / atmosphere is definitely well done and modern and you see many foreigners eating there.... But there were also a lot of local and.... Being with a local... The dishes we ordered were Thai and from the region ( dishes you could any found in the Chang Mai region). Taking about the food, we did enjoy is sooo much ! It was truly good and tasty. The service was excellent 👌👍 and fast! The garden atmosphere brings a lot and we found it cosy and quiet. We ordered a lot to be honest and we were starving but also enjoying... And when the bill came... We were shocked how so NOT EXPENSIVE it was! 850 TBH for 10 dishes plus drinks plus deserts.... is definitely more that reasonable! We can only recommend this place! Worth it 🙂

We came across this restaurant while strolling the area. We came in because of the nice atmosphere, lots of coverage and greenery. Fortunately we came at a time where there was no wait. While we were waiting for our food, people waited. But they waited under an umbrella for max 10 minutes. There is indoor seating and outdoor (covered) seating. My husband ordered the Khao with Thai sausage, which was tasty. I ordered a Northern style curry with pork (very tender. But they had small pieces of bone, which I found annoying to bit around) with jackfruit. It wasn't a coconut milk curry, so don't expect it to be creamy. This dish wasn't my first pick, I would have preferred the hung-le pork curry. But after I placed my order, they told me they didn't have it. I would expect a twice nominated Michelin star restaurant, they would know what they have in stock before people place their order. To drink we had the roselle juice and butterfly pea flower with lime juice. Both were very delicious and served with shiny silver cups. We enjoyed our time here but it would have been better had I gotten the dish I wanted in the first place.
DONT COME!!!!! tourist trap. long wait, high price, low quality food, eat at khao soi lung prakit kat kom instead, you can get 3x the food for the same price, and infinitely better quality

Unfair to rate as they don't provide for vegetarian or vegan options. Service was quick though. English speaking waitress attended. Popular though and would recommend you check it out if diet 🥦🍎🥗🍌is not fussy like mine. 🙏😉

A nice place serving small portions. The menu is very difficult to read because the font is so small. I went back in the evening and could not read it. They need to make the print larger and ignore the fancy photos. I will not return! The bowl was only about half-full of the Kao Soy, not a good place if you are hungry!

Not a great experience with service or food. Kao Soy was so so. Soup is flavorful but that's about it. Portion size is so small for the price. Service was very bad by Thai standards. The waiting boys were all the cool new modern generation who no longer can show traditional Thai hospitality. They are simply hanging out and slacking away on their phones. When I went in, none greeted me or gave me a table. So I took one free and waited at the table for 10 mins to get someone to give me a menu card! Again the staff seemed to be going away even as I gesture them to come. They didn't even come to give me my bill! Only the older lady at the billing counter was nice and warm. They didn't have mango sticky rice too.

Tbh, I'm a little bit disappointed by the food here. We came here for Khao Soi thinking it was one of the best in Chiang Mai, but it was quite average. The price though, is about 2x what you would pay for.
Best Khao soi experience four people ate generously for £20. Great price point and menu from Michelin bib gourmand recommended restaurant. Lived up to the hype.

Kao Soy is a very local Chiang Mai dish. They are served in several flavours. Don't miss out tasting them if you can. This cozy restaurant serves good kao soy. The restaurant is slightly upscale and the waiter and waitresses here can speak English. The portions served here are fairly big and the prices are reasonable. This place can get crowded a bit towards dinner time so if you want to try out this place, make sure you go early to avoid the dinner crowd or go in a bit late maybe after 8.30pm to get a table. You can see many locals and also tourist here. They also serve very delicious Mango Sticky Rice. Absolutely awesome!!! Must try dessert if you are dining in here.

Stumbled upon this Michelin-starred eatery by accident while looking to visit another renowned restaurant in Chiangmai (not knowing that other place was a reservation only venue), and settled for lunch here. The queue was really long even at 2pm, but the turnover was quick enough to get us a table within 10 minutes, aided by their expansion to a neighbouring shophouse's yard. We had a big khao soi that had a bit of everything in it and a standard bowl of beef khao soi, an extremely crispy fried egg with minced pork (wanted to try the ant eggs but the wife declined), and another bowl of soupy bamboo shoots with meat in it. As most of the food in the extensive menu (including a more exotic bamboo worms) were spicy, they provided a free plate of fried rice for our young daughter. To beat the heat, we ordered an interesting globe of dehusked coconut flesh with the juice in it, an iced chrysanthemum drink complete with a decorative flower, and a dessert reminiscent of chendol from Singapore and Malaysia. All in all, the food was pretty good, though it must be said that khao soi being a curry based staple dish in Chiangmai, is not necessarily for everyone.
Wow. The Kao Soy ( Type of Northern Thai Soup) was so good. Delicious. Michelin Recognized place. And you can see why. The food tastes good.

Atmosphere is nice However the quality of food is pretty bad, stir fried pork with vegetables has strong smell Fish on the Bamboo shoot soup aren't fresh Asked for a fork but never delivered. Very disappointed Paired over 600 for 3 ppl Won't come back for sure
The food was alright, but the customer service sucks like hell. It takes two centuries for the waiters to serve the food and take the check.
Overrated posh place for people looking for Instagram glory. There's a queue to eat northern Thai food you can find anywhere in Chiang mai torna fraction of the price... People are crazy ha

Totally overrated. Here is what we ordered….. Super Bowl curry noodles, not as big as pic showed on menu, totally not worth the price. Chicken satay, chicken is tender, but the satay sauce tastes like nothing. Spring rolls, nothing special. I’m not sure what I am eating. Northern style spicy sausage, average. Nothing special. Stir fried Gunymnma in oyster sauce, it’s okay, some local veggies I think. Tom yum goong, this one is really weird, 3-4 big pieces of ginger and just a few shrimp, and it’s 185 THB???? Green chicken curry with rice noodles, green curry sauce tastes like water, not worth it. Just somewhere I wouldn’t visit again, so many vendors on streets are better. I don’t know why people recommend this place. We can’t even use credit card to pay. Lol Oh by the way, they charge ice for 20 THB. Haha
price is great, the staff who work there are really nice! the curry noodle are so yummy and a little bit spicy, i arrived at 7:00pm just wait for a while.highly recommend!
Kao soi lived up to the hype. Perfectly made. There was a long wait but the staff politely moved everything quickly to make sure everyone got served.

Khao soi was good although could be spicier (best one we had in Chiang mai relatively speaking, because all other Khao soi's are too mild for our liking) but what blew our minds was the grilled beef skewers. OH MAMA you can go here for the Khao soi hype but please order the skewers
Not recommended. Food standard has dropped. Service unfortunately has gone out the door. Seating at extension was hot. Thankfully, there are many other better places.
Tasty kao soy;we had the shrimp and omelette one as they didn’t have halal chicken;ambiance was nice and even though wit was lunch time we were quickly served.

The location is good and the indoor deco is nice, however I would not come back here to eat. The service was poor, with different waiters visiting our table asking the same questions. The kao soy lacked flavour, wasn't warm enough and the portion of beef which accompanied it was small.
Delicious northern Thai dishes in Namman. Easy to walk to. Crowded at dinner time but the queue is not so long.

Ate here twice while in Chiang Mai! Be prepared to wait, but it’s not too long. When you get there, make sure you grab a ticket from the staff member near the front. Great khao soi! We tried a couple other things that were really good too.

The food is really good, everything we ordered was delicious. The service is fast and super friendly, we needed a taxi and when they got one for us they took us to the car door with their umbrellas. The prices are really reasonable and the portions are enough for one person.
The food is fantastic and the atmospere was very chill. Felt like a local favorite. We spent a lot of baht but we ordered a lot.

Great and quick take on Kao Soy dish. Flavorfull takes on iconic Chaing Mai cuisine. A good first stop for Northern Thai classic dishes. Aside from the Kao Soy, try the Chiang Mai sausage. The northern Thai iced drinks in a tin cup are a must-have pairing with food. All dishes are medium spicy or up. Service was quick and efficient. Most of the seating is outdoors, so plan the timing of your visit based on your heat and humidity tolerance.

This place was our first Thai dinner and expecting a lot to have famous beef kao soi However the quantity of the soup was not enough to soak the noodle. Soup was very dense. Taste was ok but the price was higher than another local kao soi noodle house in the around area. One time was enough for us to visit. We can find better priced local kao soi noodle restaurants.

Really really good food, friendly efficient service. Flavours are on point, meat really tender, seafood was fresh 10/10. Last page on the menu has delicious iced teas and juices? Not sure what it is but had the best ice tea.

This place is BUSY, but they manage to get you in quickly nonetheless. The food is very good, especially the Khao Soi. They have a few vegetarian options on the menu, and plenty for meat eaters. Staff all speak at least a little English, food comes quickly, and the prices are very reasonable. I’d definitely recommend if you’re in the area and want to try some khao soi!

The star of the menu at Kao Soy Nimman is their signature dish, Kao Soy. This traditional Northern Thai curry noodle soup is bursting with flavors, combining tender chicken or beef with a rich and fragrant curry broth. The addition of crispy egg noodles on top adds a delightful crunch to each spoonful. Apart from Kao Soy, the restaurant offers a variety of other Northern Thai specialties that are equally mouthwatering. From flavorful larb salads to aromatic gaeng hang lay curry, each dish showcases the unique blend of spices and herbs that are characteristic of Northern Thai cuisine. Whether you're a foodie looking to explore authentic Northern Thai cuisine or simply someone who appreciates good food, Kao Soy Nimman is a must-visit.

An okay restaurant but if there is a long queue I 'm sure you can find a good Kaosoy elsewhere. For me, this place doesn't taste so original since they adjust the recipe to suite with both Thai and foreigners. If you're foreigners, you may like the taste as it's mild and gently put together in a nice decoration plate.

This is a delicious restaurant. The passionfruit juice is some of the best I've ever had, and their Kao Soi is famous in Chiang Mai. They are on the Michelin restaurant list and they totally deserve it. Super tasty place.

Great Kao Soy but several other dishes are disappointing. This is a very slick operation which runs the danger of being on a conveyor feeding belt. Nearly always a queue but as table turnover is so quick there is seldom a long wait.

Michelin recommended khao soi in Chiang Mai. The flavor is quite mild. It costs more than your average khao soi but given the area it’s only to be expected. The chicken satay is good, and the portion is very generous for an appetizer.

Had a hard time deciding between 4 and 5 stars for here, obviously went with 4 stars in the end. The biggest things were the price, food quality, and portion size in comparison to other similar restaurants. Don't get me wrong, you'll get an excellent meal here and good service - for those of you who don't speak Thai you may feel more comfortable going here compared to other local restaurants that specialize in khao soi. Note, their menu is not vegetarian friendly - I didn't see a single vegetarian option on the menu and the khao soi is made with chicken stock. Meat eaters, you'll be happy here.

Khao soi is authentic and filling, regular portion is enough. It has a lot of variety and vegetarian options as well. I give 4 stars because it says Michelin recommended, however, it didn’t seem anything special to me, just good honest Khao soi. Ok if you are in the area.

This restaurant serves some of the best Khao Soi I’ve ever eaten. They also offer a wide variety of other dishes which are all delicious. I’ve come here many many times and every single time has been 10/10 delicious, and even when busy the food is quick.

This was honestly some of the best Khao Soi I've had in Chiang Mai. They had some other tasty dishes as well and you can definitely eat there as a vegetarian so that's a plus. They seem to use really good ingredients and the space itself is very pleasant. The staff are friendly and attentive. definitely would be open to coming back

The Tom yum soup was a knock out, but the big bowl was slightly over greasy. Only indoor seating was available during my visit, outdoor seating is better. Lots of attentive service, some miscommunications.
Restaurant is very busy so prepare for a little waiting time, but not much. The Khao soy is ok but there are Definetly better ones on chiang Mai. The yakitori are delicious though
Khao soi is really good. Chicken satay was not good. The waiter also told me I didn’t order the chicken satay, which was the first thing I ordered, and started to argue with me about it.

Have to change my original 5 star review to 2 stars because the portions size here decreased dramatically. This place was always a bit pricy but the quality was good and potion size was ok, however visiting again today after a few months, the price was the same as before but the size of both the vegetable and pork dish we ordered was tiny and definitely not worth the price anymore. We compared the dishes today with pictures from our last visit 3 months ago where we ordered the same dishes and the size of each portion was half or less of what it was before.

Best KaoSoy I've ever had. Nice service, but we got electricity black-out while having dinner here, kinda hot to be honest. Do not recommend the crab dish 60THB (I forgot its name) Khao soy ngon, không nên ăn cái món cua 60thb

Khoa Soi Gai was ok, but missing the depth of flavour and heat (both spiciness and temperature - it was served lukewarm) of that available at local-style restaurants and food stalls, and at twice the price. However the chicken leg was tasty and seemed to be high quality, and service was fast and efficient.

Ordered khao soi super bowl. The quality is not bad. Just very disappointed with the way they served khao soi sidedish, with very humble portion of pickle - one of key elements of khao soi. They charge 20 baht if ordering one more, I don’t mind being charged just thinking about the portion of pickle has been delivered, then just forget it.
Really popular place for food. There is usually wait here but they are efficient. Kai soy was full of flavor, almost too thick
One of the best restaurant of Khao Soi ever tried in the district of Nimman It Is worth waiting a while before enjoying such an experience. Highly recommended

The long wait wasn't worth it. We made better Kao Soy at a cooking class we attended. If you really want to eat at this place, go as a single person as you will be seated faster. When we visited the wait for groups of 2 or more was almost 1 hour.

+ : Nice place, helpful staff, good dishes even though it is not possible to adjust the spiciness of most of the dishes (but well, we are in Thailand, we need to adapt to the local culture ;)), worth the money. BUT... - : The amount of disposable plastic there is quite shocking for a restaurant of that standing. Placing the cutlery in plastic is useless, same for the chopsticks and the coconuts (very good) are served in a plastic cup with plastic straws... Please, think of our planet and try to replace all of this plastic for reusable materials :)
What a terrific experience! Very little wait time when we went and the food speaks for itself. Was literally so good I ordered a second bowl of Khao Soi!
Best Kao soy 😍 had the sausage one and it was amazing. 5 stars all the way, I recommend to all my friends visiting Chiang Mai to come to this place.

Unfortunately a really bad eating experience. A first in Thailand - they ran out of rice, only to then keep serving rice to other tables. One dish then came, and we waited for 5 minutes before deciding its best to eat it whilst it's still warm - a decent khao Soi with melty beef. Unfortunately the other dish never came and we weren't told why...it felt like they were never going to serve us the dish and just wait for us to leave. Best part was paying and not having to argue to remove the item that never came.

Taste is most certainly up there with the best I've had in Chiang Mai. Unfortunately the portion is half the size of anywhere else for double the price. Also, my dish was almost cold by the time it arrived at my table. Underwhelming given the price point and 'reputation'.

Very good, service was polite and swift, everything tasted good. Wish I had a bit more noodles in my khao soi kai, but the sticky rice was on point and I really appreciated that they asked if I wanted ice. Will update with pictures next time I go.

Khao Soy was not served hot. Not sure if it’s meant to be that way. But the other dishes ordered (spring roll, calamari tempura) was good though a tad bit oily. Do order the chicken satay! That was the best. Overall enjoyable.
Come here every time I am in ChiangMai. Very tasty Kao Soy and lots of variety of other dishes. Gets busy during lunch and dinner hour, which is always a good sign :)
That good kao soi and other manu are perfect.
Khao Soi was very delicious. A pricy but that's how it is near Nimman. Kind of disappointed about the plain rice with egg for my daughter though, which was advertised as fried rice for children.
khao soi with beef was the perfect❤️

The food and drinks were great! The restaurant seemed clean enough and is beautifully decorated with lots of plants. The service was ok but kind of confusing and messy. I tried to get directions to the toilet but they seemed uninterested in helping me getting there. The toilets were in another bar and there are signs in the back of the restaurant.
The place is nice, modern with plenty of tourists. Prices are pretty high. Khao Soi was really tasty, but in Chiang Mai you can find tasty food in much lower prices.
It's not worth the visit. Only the kaho soy is good, rest of the food is pricey and mediocre. Service is really bad, you have to wait a long time and recive your order partially.

Famous for Khao Soi and there are different topping to choose from - chicken, beef, pork, seafoods, etc. It's all great except the seafood. Doubt about its freshness. This place offers a variety of thai dessert too. The ambience is cozy and service is friendly and fast. Unfortunately, this place closes at 8pm. If you plan to go there for dinner, there to be there earlier, some of the items on menu would not be available at 7pm onward.
Nice big fan. Curry noddle soup (kao soi) is so rich as another one Khao soi mae sai. Chicken skewer is tender and satay sauce is yummy.

This place has the biggest variety of Khao soi I've seen. Lots of unique variations (even one using green curry)... It may not all me traditional, but it's a great place if you want to try something different. The quality is good, price is a bit higher than usual but sti reasonable.. nice atmosphere and attentive staff too. I'll be back for sure!
The shrimp and squid are not fresh, over rated. Could be three stars, but I’ll give it two considering there are so many great restaurants in Chiang Mai.
Such a really really good food, the beef one that I ordered was so soft, the broth was thick and savory. It's very crowded, so be aware of it. But if you're aline, might get the seat way faster.
amazing kao soy! our waitress recommended the pork kao soy and we liked it a lot! there might be a short wait time to get a table.
Tasty, but very small portion. If you're actually hungry and not just looking for a snack, you'll need to order multiple items from the menu. Khao soi gai was deliciois though

Good kao soy, mediocre service. Lots of staff, not many doing very much. Took ages to clear dishes and for us to order dessert, even though people were queueing out of the door waiting for a table. Kao soy was nice though. Thick, tasty sauce, but slightly Luke warm
very nice curry noodles！ highly recommended. We arrived at about 1 PM, and the waiting time is less than mins, acceptable.

Kho Soi pork is amazing. Must get this! My partner said the chayote leaves were the best he's ever had (not for me though. I don't like strong smoky flavor). Not worth it to get other dishes. They are ok, but not excellent. Iced teas are a tad too sugary for my taste, but lovely and refreshing and not to mention beautiful!

My boyfriend and I visited this place twice in the three days we were in Chiang Mai. It's not located within the Old City but it's well worth the visit! The khao soi is way cheaper with great, if not better, flavor than others we tried. Definitely try the crispy pork one...Highly recommend!

We had khao soi dishes (beef and seafood) and an appetizer. They were all very small and khao soi was too salty. I’ve had khao soi in Toronto that’s several degrees better than the one from this place. What worsened our experience here was the poor service of the waitresses/waiters. They were all frowning for some reason and were hesitant to come and help. I’m sorry but when i’m paying money to eat food somewhere, i shouldn’t have to feel like i’m bothering them.
Excellent food, fast service. I’m still thinking about this place and want to go back and eat the same thing again. Khao Soy, Satay, Wonton, Drinks were all outstanding.

The food was not impressive at all. Khao soi itself was not rich enough. Really common flavor. The softshell crab was not really fresh. It's a nice place for pictures and check in. But it's definitely not the place for you to have amazing food.

[please "like" if this is helpful] Iconic Khao Soi in Chiang Mai Nimman area. Popular, casual, fun, delicious, clean. Quality ingredients in the main meal and traditional desserts. Staff is attentive and skilled. LPT: do not wear white clothing when eating Khao Soi 😂
We were waiting 30 min. outside while there were 7 free tables and they would't let anyone from the queue sit.
The food was nothing great given the high prices

Popular place for Khao Soi. If you're headed in the evening, chances are you will wait in line. Ordered Hang Lay which was nice. Unfortunately couldn't par take in their main specialty because of gluten intolerance, but friends seemed to enjoy it. Note dishes are a bit small for the western appetite.
Food is good but expensive. Ambiance is good. Can dine inside with AC or outside. Waiters are polite and attentive.
Love the Veggies Stirred fry here. Thai omelette here is yummy. A bit more expensive than the street food but it is a proper restaurant so you must expect that.

Was here in July 2018. Place was very easy to find, in a small alley but Google map is exactly correct. Located in the middle of tourist area anyway. Parking area only for some bikes and motorbikes. Lovely, peaceful and green in garden-like atmosphere. Rather small tables, won't be very convenient for very large group. Had khao soi moo tod for 69B. Taste quite delicious, but IMO too tailored for tourist (i.e not using enough spice). Large enough dish size, pretty presentation. Altogether worth the price.
A restaurant serving mainly curry noodles and other simple local food. Not expensive, quick service and popular among thai people. Nothing wrong with the food really - just not my cup of tea.
Popular place to eat Kai Soy. They have their own variations with seafood or pork. I tried the original one; tasty but not mind-blowing. Not worth the line, in case there is one.

Very good khao soi with lots of protein options. Staff could be more attentive though as it's hard to get their attention or service and last time I was there I walked out since they never took my order. Popular spot among Chinese tourists.

Excellent service, friendly and generous. local feel yet convenient seating. Average food, not the tastiest Khao soi I had. A bit geared towards tourists and expats, which reflects in higher prices compared to other local places.
Hands down best Khao Soi noodles had the soft shell crab and it was a game changer

This place always looks busy when I walk by so today I decided to eat food there. I can't remember what the name of the dish I got was, but it was fried pork with noodles for 69baht. Tasted great & service was quick. The rest of the menu also had fairly cheap options. I'll plan to come back here in the future.
I'm totally in love with basically the WHOLE MENU. For sure!!!! Love very dishes from beef, to signature Khao Soi, 😋 👌. A highly recommend place my friend. And having a Michellin guide by the way.
Tasty Kao Soy at a good price. It can get too busy in peak hours (late afternoons are good to visit) They can not do less spicy ( so if you can't manage spicy food than it's not for you) :(

I had the pork Khao Soi recommended by the wait staff. It was served quickly but it could have been a lot hotter (temperature-wise), which is risky. I'm not sure if it was just me because the place was really busy, but after that I tried Khao Soi at a couple other places and thought the one I had here was just OK.
Food tastes amazing! This place exceeded my expectations, great vibe, quick service, price reasonable. Lovely garden to chill and eat with your friends. Will return.

A great place to get Khao Soi in the Nimman area. I particularly like it with the spicy northern sausage. If you would like to try bugs but feel intimidated, the bamboo worm appetizer is a good way to go.
Had to wait about 5 minutes for lunch. Kao soi, chicken satay, and vegetables were all good, but not the best we've had. On the pricier side but you pay for nice atmosphere and convenience.
What you order will be what you getting + food taste good. Service can be better. Need more attention to customer’s detailings. I learned that Every table in Chiang mai has a place for the trash 👍🏻
almost server's is no good. not kind!!!! but foods is good
I ordered kao soi braised beef, beef Jim Joom and hung lay from this place today. If I could give higher than 5/5 I most certainly would. Everything was amazing. Well done!!!!
Absolutely mid. Over hyped place with inflated prices. Honestly one of the worse places we’ve been to in Chiang Mai.

I had this Kao Soy dish in another restaurant in Old City and it was soo delicious that I really wanted to try it in this restaurant. But based on my opinion, this is not as per the expectations, and was not that great.. or maybe it's just different people, different taste..

Beef satay was sooooo good. I’d come back just for that. I also ordered two khao soys with different toppings, fried wontons with minced pork, pork belly curry, pennywort and butterfly pea lime drink. All were delicious but definitely try the satay.
